name: Webinar: Information-Theoretic Probing with Minimum Description Length
description: ‚ñ∫ Topic: Information-Theoretic Probing with Minimum Description Length ‚ñ∫ Speaker: Elena Voita, a Ph.D. student at the University of Edinburgh and the University of Amsterdam ‚ñ∫ Who will be interested: We will discuss enhanced ways of measuring what the BERT and ELMo models can learn. The talk will be of particular interest to people trying to use pre-trained models in practice, as well as to people with a more general interest in model analysis and/or representation learning. Attendees will get the most out of this talk if they have an awareness of these popular pre-trained models and understand their usefulness for downstream tasks. ‚ñ∫ Language: English ‚ñ∫ Registration: forms.gle/uhmCJ8cys2K2ZVyT9 The event is free with mandatory registration. Please look out for a confirmation email with all the necessary information and links to online streaming. "How can you know whether a model (e.g., ELMo, BERT) has learned to encode a linguistic property? The most popular approach to measure how well pretrained representations encode a linguistic property is to use the accuracy of a probing classifier (probe). However, such probes often fail to adequately reflect differences in representations, and they can show different results depending on probe hyperparameters. As an alternative to standard probing, we propose information-theoretic probing which measures minimum description length (MDL) of labels given representations. In addition to probe quality, the description length evaluates ‚Äòthe amount of effort‚Äô needed to achieve this quality. We show that (i) MDL can be easily evaluated on top of standard probe-training pipelines, and (ii) compared to standard probes, the results of MDL probing are more informative, stable, and sensible."

Community was established in 2015. Developers of all skill levels are welcome to join us. It doesn't matter if you're new to the world of Google technologies, we're always happy to see new faces. We organize and take part in a variety of activities: technical meetings, hackathons, work shops, seminars, IT schools, and of course the annual Google I/O Extended. Every year we come together for the most important local event for Google developers ‚Äî GDG DevFest Kaliningrad. Experts from our region and other cities and countries share their collective experience in many areas: from mobile apps to Front-end development, Android Wear, IoT, design and security.

description: –ü—Ä–æ–π–¥–∏—Ç–µ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –≤–≤–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–∫ –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω. –†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ–º, –∫–∞–∫ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω SMM-–º–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ç–∏–Ω–≥, –æ –µ–≥–æ –≤–ª–∏—è–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–∞ –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä—É –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç—ã, –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –ö—É—Ä—Å SMM ‚Äî Social Media Marketing Specialist Diploma ‚Äî —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–Ω –≤ –î—É–±–ª–∏–Ω–µ. –ò–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å, –≤ –ò—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∏–∏, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω—ã —à—Ç–∞–±-–∫–≤–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä—ã Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, Google, Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Linkedin, Yahoo!, Ebay –∏ –¥—Ä. –û–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Ç —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –ª—É—á—à–∏—Ö. –ù–∞—à –∫—É—Ä—Å SMM –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω –≤–µ–¥—É—â–∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏, –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π: Google, Microsoft, Facebook, PayPal, Twitter –∏ Ogilvy. Social Media Marketing Specialist Diploma ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è –∏ –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è SMM –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –í –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –∫—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤ SMM –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏, –≤—Å–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º—ã Digital Marketing Institute –∞–∫–∫—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –ø–æ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–∞–º EQF/Europe, QCF/England and North Ireland –∏ SCQF/ Scotland. –≠—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ digital-–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –æ–ø—ã—Ç –≤ SMM –∏ digital –º—ã –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏–ª–∏ –ª—É—á—à–µ–π —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–æ–π. –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ Instagram ‚Äî 2 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è, 6 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤. Facebook ‚Äî 2 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è, 6 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤. Vkontakte ‚Äî 2 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è, 6 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤. OK + myTarget ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Telegram, Twitter, LIinkedin, Snapchat, Tik-tok, Yandex-zen ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. YouTube ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Influencer marketing ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Community managment ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Content creation ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Content outreach ‚Äî 1 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ, 3 —á–∞—Å–∞. Strategy&Planning ‚Äî 2 –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è, 6 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤. –ó–∞—â–∏—Ç–∞ –¥–∏–ø–ª–æ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞. –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É DSKUL? –ì–ª—É–±–æ–∫–æ–µ –ø–æ–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –û–±—ä—ë–º–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞. –ú–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å. –ö–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Å –ª—É—á—à–∏–º–∏ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º–∏. –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∞ "–±–µ–∑ –≤–æ–¥—ã". –°–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç. –ì–∏–±–∫–∞—è –æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞. –°—Ç–∞–∂–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞ –≤ digital-–∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ö –∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö ‚Äî –º—ã –¥–∞—ë–º –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç–∞–∂–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫—É –≤ digital-–∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ö –∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö, –∞ –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º —Ç—Ä—É–¥–æ—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å—Å—è. –î–ª—è –∫–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ Social Media Marketing. –î–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä—É. –î–ª—è —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ—é—â–∏—Ö –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-–∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º. –î–ª—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∏ –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–ª—å—Ü–µ–≤ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞. –î–ª—è —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ —Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–º–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ digital –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤.

name: The very first meetup
description: Hello! The first meetup will be held this Friday, April, 17th, at 6PM. If you haven‚Äôt done so yet, please "RSVP" (i.e. confirm you are planning to attend). The venue: CNTI Progress, –°—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç –í.–û., –¥. 36/40, 5 —ç—Ç–∞–∂ Agenda: 18:00 Intro to the event 18:05 Marat and Alexey will share their experience building a convolutional neural network in https://www.kaggle.com/c/datasciencebowl . 19-05 break 19:15 Alexey will speak on the trends in Russian Data Science community based on discussions at AIST 2015. (http://aistconf.org/) Hope to see you all. For updates please refer to the meetup page: http://bitly.com/spbdsm ------------------------------------------------------------------------ –ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ü–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –≤ —ç—Ç—É –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É, 17 –∞–ø—Ä–µ–ª—è, –≤ —à–µ—Å—Ç—å –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∞. –ü–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞, –ø–æ–¥—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–¥–∏—Ç–µ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ (—É–∫–∞–∂–∏—Ç–µ Yes –≤ RSVP –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∫–µ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏), –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã –µ—â–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∏. –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ: –¶–ù–¢–ò –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å, –°—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç –í.–û., –¥. 36/40, 5 —ç—Ç–∞–∂ –†–∞—Å–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ: 18:00 –í—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ 18:05 –ú–∞—Ä–∞—Ç –∏ –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –ø–æ–¥–µ–ª—è—Ç—Å—è –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–≤–µ—Ä—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –≤ https://www.kaggle.com/c/datasciencebowl . 19-05 –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤ 19:15 –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç –æ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ö –≤ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ—è–∑—ã—á–Ω–æ–º Data Science —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ (–ø–æ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞–º AIST 2015 (http://aistconf.org/)) –ë—É–¥–µ–º —Ä–∞–¥—ã –≤—Å–µ—Ö –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å. –ó–∞ –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ —Å–ª–µ–¥–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞: http://bitly.com/spbdsm

name: –í–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä "–ö–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω—ã—Ö LeSS —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–π"
description: –í –ø—Ä–µ–¥–¥–≤–µ—Ä–∏–∏ –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π LeSS –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ç Scrum.ua –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∏–≤–µ–Ω—Ç, –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–º —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω—ã—Ö LeSS —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–π. "We need less LeSS adoptions" ‚Äî –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —à—É—Ç–∫–∞ –æ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤ Large Scale Scrum. –ò —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞. –í–µ–¥—å –¥–æ —Ç–µ—Ö –ø–æ—Ä, –ø–æ–∫–∞ –º—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞–µ–º —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é –∏–ª–∏ –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∫–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ, –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–µ, –º—ã —Ç–µ—Ä—è–µ–º —Å–∞–º—É —Å—É—Ç—å. –ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ª–∏ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—ã–º, —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º –∏–ª–∏ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º? –ù–µ—Ç. –≠—Ç–æ –ø—É—Ç—å, –∏ —Å–∞–º–æ –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –≤–∞–∂–Ω–µ–µ —Ü–µ–ª–∏. –¢–∞–∫ –∏ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–π –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏. –≠—Ç–æ ‚Äî –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å, –∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç. –ò –Ω–∞ –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω-–º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–µ –º—ã –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ —Ç–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –î–ù–ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—è—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø—É—Ç—å —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã —Å–æ–π—Ç–∏—Å—å, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –∏ –∞–Ω—Ç–∏-–ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ —Ç—É—Ç –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –µ—â—ë –æ–±–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–º –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –∏–∑ –Ω–∞—à–∏—Ö –ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Å–∞–ª—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–π. –ù–∞ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–µ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞—Ç—å: ‚óè –õ–µ–≤–æ–Ω –ì–æ–Ω—á–∞—Ä–æ–≤, Agile Coach & Co-Founder –≤ AgileVerse, Scrum Master c 2011 –≥–æ–¥–∞, —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–π (–°–±–µ—Ä–±–∞–Ω–∫, –ê–ª—å—Ñ–∞–ë–∞–Ω–∫ –ö–∞–∑–∞—Ö—Å—Ç–∞–Ω), c–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –∏–≥—Ä—ã –ø—Ä–æ —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ Scrum, —Å–æ–∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ Scrum Puzzle, —Å–æ–∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä –ø–æ–¥–∫–∞—Å—Ç–∞ –°–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä—è–Ω–∞—è –ß–ø—É–ª—è. "–¢—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –ö–∞–∫ –∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –≤–æ–ª–æ–Ω—Ç—ë—Ä–æ–≤ –≤ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏? –í–æ–ª–æ–Ω—Ç—ë—Ä—ã ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –ª—é–¥–∏ –∏–∑ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã –ø–æ–¥—Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ò –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –∏–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º ‚Äî –∫–∞–∫ –∏—Ö –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –∏ –∫–∞–∫ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–º —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è". ‚óè –ú–∏—Ö–∞–∏–ª –í—è–∑–∞–Ω–∫–∏–Ω, –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥—á–∏–∫ Scrum Guide, Kanban Guide for Scrum Teams –Ω–∞ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫, –µ–≤–∞–Ω–≥–µ–ª–∏—Å—Ç –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∞ Kaizen –≤ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, Accredited Kanban Trainer –≤ Kanban University, Agile Coach & Founder –≤ AgileVerse. "–ú—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å: *–ü—Ä–æ –ª—é–¥–µ–π –∏ –ø—Å–∏—Ö–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—é –≤–æ–ª–æ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–∞ *–ü—Ä–æ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞ –∏ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏—è –≤ B2B –∏ B2C *–ü—Ä–æ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫ –≤ Less-adoption". ‚óè –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –ö—Ä–∏–≤–∏—Ü–∫–∏–π, Certified Scrum Trainer ¬Æ –≤ Scrum Alliance, Agile Coach & Founder –≤ Scrum.ua , –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥—á–∏–∫ –∏ —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏ "Scrum –∏ XP: –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —Å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤–æ–π" –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä –∫–Ω–∏–≥ "–ë—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç –≤ agile —Ä–µ—Ç—Ä–æ—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ã" –∏ "Powerful Coaching Interventions". ‚óè –ï–≤–≥–µ–Ω–∏–π –õ–∞–±—É–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π, Agile Coach & Founder –≤ Scrum.ua , Certified Scrum Professional ¬Æ –≤ ScrumAlliance —Å 10+ –≥–æ–¥–∞–º–∏ –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ agile –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏. ‚óè –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –•–æ–¥–∞–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π, Agile Coach, Certified Scrum Professional ¬Æ –≤ ScrumAlliance —Å 5+ –≥–æ–¥–∞–º–∏ –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ—É—á–∏–Ω–≥–∞, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ –≤ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ä–µ–¥–µ. –†–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å, —ç—Ç–æ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ!

name: Webinar "Boosting sales in online channels"
description: Boosting sales in online channels became an especially important topic during the quarantine ‚Äî as we closed all the shops, the only way to reach our customers was online. But how to make our online channels work better? Tele2 Chief Sales Officer ‚Äî Aare Uusj√§rv ‚Äî will share Tele2 experiences in boosting e-channels sales. Speaker: üîπAare Uusj√§rv is the CSO of Tele2 Eesti ‚Äî a telecommunications company offering calls and internet packages to private and business customers. He has over twenty years of experience in e-channels and sales. Before Tele2, Aare worked as the Head of Sales in If Insurance, where he moved most of the sales from the ‚Äòface to face‚Äô format to e-channels. Aare believes: luck and coincidence have nothing to do with good sales and successful client relationships. "It‚Äôs the opposite," he says, "to succeed in sales and have great relationships with the clients, the business itself has to grow and learn from mistakes." üìç Join us live on Facebook . We will publish a video when the event starts! üóì Add it to your calendar ‚Äî shorturl.at/hkwLO _ _ _ This event is organized by LIFT99co ‚Äî the most vibrant startup community in Tallinn and Kyiv where we also run co-working spaces. If you‚Äôre interested in joining a community or looking for a cool place to work from, check for more information here ‚Äî www.lift99.co

description: –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∫—É—Ä—Å –í–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ Python –ø—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∞–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–æ–≤, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∏ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ —Å –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ö–æ—Ç—è—Ç –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—å —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏: –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–∏, –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç; –æ—Å–≤–æ–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø—ã —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π; –∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å, –∫–∞–∫ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –≤ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–µ; —Ä–∞–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–º–∏ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π; –æ—Å–≤–æ–∏—Ç—å –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥—ã —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã–º–∏ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∞–º–∏; –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –¥–∞—Ç–∞—Å–µ—Ç—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –∫ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é; –Ω–∞—É—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π; –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–ø—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ –∫—É—Ä—Å–∞: https://www.bigdataschool.ru/courses-data-science-and-machine-learning/–∫—É—Ä—Å-–≤–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ-–≤-–Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ-—Å–µ—Ç–∏-–Ω–∞-python.html –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: BigDataSchool –ù–∞—à–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è "–®–∫–æ–ª–∞ –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –î–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö" –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ–º —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∫—É—Ä—Å—ã –ø–æ Big Data (–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ) –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—ã, –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –ø–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–º –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º: –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, Data Mining, Internet of Things, Industrial Internet of Things, —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–∞—è —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è, –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç—ã —ç–∫–æ—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã Hadoop, Apache Spark,Kafka, NiFi, AirFlow,HBase, NoSQL, –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–ª–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º —Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ –æ–∑–µ—Ä –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö (Data Lakes) –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ö Cloudera Distributed Hadoop, –ê—Ä–µ–Ω–∞–¥–∞—Ç–∞ Hadoop, HortonWorks Data Platform –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ.

name: Personas‚Äô Stories with Nati | Episode 3
description: Folks, We‚Äôre excited to announce our third episode on June 25 üî• No registrations! Join Facebook Live stream Personas‚Äô Stories with Nati at 8 PM EEST. name: Webinar "Marketing strategy for startups"
description: Developing a marketing strategy is one of the most important stages while building your startup. It‚Äôs crucial to understand how are you going to present your company to the world and how you‚Äôll set yourself apart from the competitors. Investing in marketing is key in building brand awareness, customer attraction, generating sales, and growing your company. Developing a marketing strategy doesn‚Äôt always cost a lot of money, but it definitely requires time, effort, creativity, and knowledge about your product, market you want to enter, and, of course, your potential clients. So what are the main ‚Äûrules" of building a successful marketing strategy? Join us on Monday, May 18th, to have a conversation about: ‚úîÔ∏è Why marketing strategy is so important when building a startup? ‚úîÔ∏è What are the necessary dos in the process of developing your strategy and what are the don‚Äôts? ‚úîÔ∏è What tips&tricks you can use while building your strategy? ‚úîÔ∏è Outsourcing your marketing strategy development. Is it crucial to hire a marketing agency or in-house power should be enough? ‚úîÔ∏è How does the current crisis influence the development of the strategy and how to adapt quickly to new circumstances? Speaker üé§: üî∏Alex Briukhovetskyi ‚Äî Marketing Strategist & Startup Enterprene–≥r, co-founder & COO at Neyra. Neyra is and intuitive Al-based service for sales & marketing analytics. It aggregates data from ad accounts, site visits statistics and CRM in 1 simple and customizable dashboard. The setup process will take just a couple of clicks and no technical background required. name: Webinar 2.0: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
description: Virtido invites everyone interested to take part in Webinar 2.0: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Deployment and management of containerized applications made easy with a fully-managed Kubernetes service. Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) offers serverless Kubernetes, an integrated continuous integration and continuous delivery (CICD) experience, enterprise-level security and governance. Unite your development and operations teams on a single platform to rapidly build, deliver, and scale applications with confidence. Webinar objectives: ‚óè overview Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), ‚óè streamline horizontal scaling, ‚óè self-healing, ‚óè load balancing, and secret management, ‚óè AKS virtual node ‚óè Implementing secure DevOps together with Kubernetes on Azure (theory and practice). Our Speaker ‚Äî Taras Kolodchyn. 13+ years of hands-on experience in application development. He is familiar with every stage of the application development lifecycle starting with a general project idea and ending with product delivery and support. Worked as Developer, DevOps and Architect. Currently occupies the role of the Senior DevOps at Evolute, DevOps consultant at Virtido, Lead Solutions Architect at Smart IT. Language: Ukrainian Register for receiving an email with a link on the webinar: forms.gle/Kn5EmuQ8woq3Tjw47 See you online on July 09 at 18:00!

name: Webinar "Design thinking. What is it? And why is it important for startups?"
description: An unquestionable fact: startups move fast. You create, test, and (often) fail even before you figure things out ‚Äî learning by doing. And sometimes you may not know your problem yet. For instance, you‚Äôre just starting out, you may have difficulty fully articulating your startup solution. Or you may know that you have points of friction somewhere, but can‚Äôt fully identify them. Here comes design thinking methodology ‚Äî when you need to identify something you can‚Äôt verbalize. It‚Äôs a step-by-step methodology that helps you identify your problem and come up with numerous creative solutions. It‚Äôs perfect for quickly and iteratively identifying how to solve problems. Join to find out: üîπ What design thinking is? üîπ How can it be helpful for startups? üîπ What are the main instruments you can use? üîπ Why empathy is so important? üîπ Why prototyping is crucial? üé§ Speaker: üî∏ Iryna Pulvas ‚Äî founder & CEO of ZIRITY & independent design thinking consultant; curated Design Thinking course at Techstars Startup Week Kyiv 2017 and facilitated more than 300 hours of workshops. üìç Join us live on Facebook . We will publish a video when the event starts! üóì Add it to your calendar ‚Äî shorturl.at/GLU12

name: Webinar "Angular 10 best practices"
description: Choosing a front-end for your project can be a headache if you have a basic knowledge of the modern technologies. What to choose? React/Angular/Vue.js/Svelte ? And even after you have chosen specific technology, you have a long way to go through errors and disappointments to improve your skills. Since Angular 2 a lot of new versions have released for the past four years. During this period, we have gained invaluable experience in our Angular projects, which we want to share. So we prepare a talk on the best practices that we use ourselves. This talk will be useful for both front-end and full-stack developers and will save them time and avoid the pitfalls that sometimes occurs when developing Angular projects. We will focus on the following topics: ‚Äî TypeScript 2/3 features to pay attention ‚Äî Design and structure of the Angular projects ‚Äî Libraries for Angular. Which to use and which not. ‚Äî Most useful Angular 9/10 features ‚Äî Common pitfalls ‚Äî Optimization and performance improvement The speaker is Sergiy Morenets , developer with more than 20 years of programming experience, author of programming books and frequent speaker at Java and JS conferences. This webinar will start on October 12th, at 19:30 EET. You will receive email with live broadcast link two days before the start. This is online webinar for front-end developers of any level. name: Webinar "Spring Data vs JPA"
description: JPA specification is part of Java (Jakarta EE) and one of the key aspects of ORM technology usage. Most developers use Hibernate as JPA provider and smart/mature integration with Spring/Spring Boot . It will provide IoC, Spring beans, declarative transaction and resource management. There‚Äôs also another player in this area ‚Äî Spring Data JPA . This project started in 2008 and focused on removing boilerplate code and simplifying relational database programming for Java developers. If you you Spring Data you will get repository abstraction for CRUD operations, declarative queries and integration with most popular relational/NoSQL databases. We migrated to Spring Data 4 years ago and gathered a lot of experience and positive feedback. However Spring Data magic sometimes scares away developers and forces them to use simpler solution like Spring JDBC or jOOQ. In this talk we will cover the following topics: 1) Core differences between JPA and Spring Data usage 2) Our migration story JPA -> Spring Data 3) Spring Data pitfalls/best practices The speaker is Sergey Morenets , back-end developer with more than 20 years of programming experience, frequent speaker at Java conferences. This webinar will start on August 18th, at 19:30 EET. You will receive email with live broadcast link two days before the start. This is online webinar for Java developers of any level. Registration link: it-simulator.com/...pring-data-vs-jpa?lang=en

description: –û —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä–µ: –ê—Ä—Ç–µ–º –ë—ã–∫–æ–≤–µ—Ü ‚Äî CEO / Organizational & Agile Coach at Simplesense & CEO at "StartIT training center"; –ü–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç —Å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤ –∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–∏–º –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è–º: Competera, McDonald‚Äôs Ukraine, Kuehne-Nagel, Intertop Ukraine, Rozetka, Levi9, Owox, StarlightMedia Production, Skylum, –ù–∞—à –§–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç, –ü—Ä–æ–∑–æ—Ä—Ä–æ, OWOX –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–º –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º –ò–º–µ–µ—Ç —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ç—ã: CSM, CSPO, CSP, CSP-SM, CSP-PO, CAL-I by ScrumAlliance, CLP by LeSS.works, PSM I by Scrum.org , Certified KMP I by LeanKanbanUniversity –û –≤–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–µ: –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å –µ—Å—Ç—å 3-5 –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–æ–≤ "–º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è" Agile/Scrum (—Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –Ω–∏—Ö SAFe, DAD, Nexus, SoS –∏ LeSS). –ê—Ä—Ç–µ–º —É–∂–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 3—Ö –ª–µ—Ç —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑—É–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ LeSS –∏ –ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è–º –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å LeSS-like –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –∏–∑ –µ–¥–∏–Ω–æ–≥–æ –±–µ–∫–ª–æ–≥–∞ –Ω–∞ –æ–±—â–∏–º –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–º –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥! –í –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä–µ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –ê—Ä—Ç–µ–º –ª–µ—Ç–∞–ª –≤ NYC –∏ –æ–±—É—á–∞–ª—Å—è —É –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ LeSS –∏ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã—Ö Scrum & XP –∫–æ—É—á–µ–π –≤ –º–∏—Ä–µ ‚Äî –ö—Ä—ç–≥–∞ –õ–∞—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∞! –ù–∞ –≤–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–µ –ê—Ä—Ç–µ–º –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç –≤–∞—Å —Å –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–∞–º–∏, –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞–º–∏ –∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∞–º–∏ –∫ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—é –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–π –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ–º–æ—â–∏ LeSS (Large Enterprise Scale Scrum ‚Äî –ë–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –ï–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–ø—Ä–∞–π–∑ –ú–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—ã–π –°–∫—Ä–∞–º) —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∞. –ü–ª–∞–Ω –≤–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–∞: 1. –ù–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ —Å–µ–±–µ :) 2. –ö–∞–∫–∞—è —Ü–µ–ª—å –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ª–µ–∂–∏—Ç –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ LeSS? –ß—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å? 3. LeSS —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –∏ –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–∞: –∫–∞–∫ –ø–æ–º–æ—á—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ –≤ 3-24 –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã –Ω–∞–¥ –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–º. 4. –ö–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏–π –æ–±–∑–æ—Ä LeSS –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤. 5. –°–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ Product Owner‚Äôs –∏ —Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ Backlog‚Äôs –∏ –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É? 6. –ß—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ Feature Teams –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –∏—Ö —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å? 7. –ê –∫–∞–∫ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ç—ã? –ö–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å Product Backlog Refinement ("–≥—Ä—É–º–∏–Ω–≥")? 8. –ê —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à–∏ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ :) –î–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–µ –≤–∏–¥–µ–æ Agile & Scrum ‚Äî –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∏ –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ–µ –ø–æ–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ . –¶–µ–ª–µ–≤–∞—è –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è: –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏ –∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤—â–∏–∫–∏, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏–µ –≤ Agile & Scrum, —Ç–∏–º–ª–∏–¥—ã –∏ –º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä—ã, –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã, –∂–µ–ª–∞—é—â–∏–µ –ª—É—á—à–µ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å —Å—É—Ç—å Agile –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–æ–≤. –ü–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ: itvdn.com/...um=dou&utm_campaign=Scrum

name: –ö–ª—É–± –°–∫—Ä–∞–º-–ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–≤ #1
description: –ü—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –∫ –¥—Ä—É–∂–µ–ª—é–±–Ω–æ–º—É –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø—É –¥–ª—è –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö –°–∫—Ä–∞–º-–ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–≤: "–°—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω—ã", "–ù–µ–∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–π –°–∫—Ä–∞–º-–º–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä" –∏ "–í—á–µ—Ä–∞—à–Ω—è—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞". –ú—ã –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏–∑—É—á–∏–º –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã –∏ –∑–∞–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ–º –∏—Ö –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö. –í—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º Zoom –∏ Miro. –†–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –Ω–∞ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø –ø–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ http://agilix.ru/scrum-patterns-club-1 –°—Å—ã–ª–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ Zoom-–∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—é –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ç –∑–∞ —Å—É—Ç–∫–∏ –¥–æ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–∞ –Ω–∞ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—É—é –ø–æ—á—Ç—É, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –≤—ã —É–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã –Ω–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∏ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫—É, —Ç–æ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞–º –Ω–∞ [masked] –ß—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –°–∫—Ä–∞–º-–ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã? –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª –°–∫—Ä–∞–º–∞ –Ω–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –≤–∞—Å —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–º –≤ –°–∫—Ä–∞–º–µ, —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∫–∞–∫ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª –∏–≥—Ä—ã –≤ —à–∞—Ö–º–∞—Ç—ã –Ω–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –≤–∞—Å –≥—Ä–æ—Å—Å–º–µ–π—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–æ–º. –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ –°–∫—Ä–∞–º—É –æ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –°–∫—Ä–∞–º–∞, –∞ –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã –°–∫—Ä–∞–º–∞ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è—é—Ç –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º, –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —Å —É—á–µ—Ç–æ–º –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–∞. –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Inspired by Agile Moscow Meetup Are you infected by Agile? This is a group for anyone interested in Agile and Scrum. If you like coffee with donuts and want to spend a few hours of your time with fun while discussing relevant topics with your IT colleagues, playing games - you're welcome. We often use Lean Coffee and other fun meeting formats for our gatherings. Hope you'll enjoy them and we really hope to meet you soon.

name: SPb Jenkins Meetup #7. Jenkins –∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ
description: 25 –∏—é–ª—è –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–µ SEMrush –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥–µ—Ç —Å–µ–¥—å–º–∞—è –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ Jenkins –≤ –°–∞–Ω–∫—Ç-–ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥–µ. –¢–µ–º–∞ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ - Jenkins –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ú—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –æ–± –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ Java-—Å—Ç–µ–∫–∞ (JUnit, FindBugs, Allure, –∏ —Ç.–¥.), –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫ Jenkins Pipeline. –î–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã: ‚Ä¢ –û–ª–µ–≥ –ù–µ–Ω–∞—à–µ–≤, CloudBees - –†–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–ª–∞–≥–∏–Ω–æ–≤ Jenkins –≤ ci.jenkins.io - "–Ø —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É –∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∂—É, –∫–∞–∫ –º—ã –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑—É–µ–º —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–ª–∞–≥–∏–Ω–æ–≤ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–µ Jenkins‚Ä¶ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é Jenkins. –ö–∞–∫ –º—ã –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—Å—è —Å–æ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º–∏ Java/Maven-—Å—Ç—ç–∫–∞? –ö–∞–∫ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω—ã –Ω–∞—à–∏ –±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫–∏ Pipeline, –∏ –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É –≤ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ–≤ –Ω–∞–º –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –æ–¥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—á–Ω—ã—Ö Jenkinsfile?". –ö–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞: Pipeline, Docker, Maven, JUnit, FindBugs ‚Ä¢ –°—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—Å–ª–∞–≤ –û–≤—á–∞—Ä, –≠–ª–∫–æ–º+ - –¢–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ/–æ—Ç–ª–∞–¥–∫–∞ Jenkins Pipeline –∏ –µ–≥–æ –±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫ - "–°—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—Å–ª–∞–≤ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç –æ —Ç–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –æ–Ω —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç Jenkins Pipeline –≤ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞—Ö. –û–Ω –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –æ —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–µ JenkinsPipelineUnit (https://github.com/lesfurets/JenkinsPipelineUnit) –∏ –æ —Å–≤–æ—ë–º –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–µ Pipeline DSL Seed (https://github.com/headcrabmeat/pipeline-dsl-seed) –¥–ª—è –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ Pipeline –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ Jenkins". –ö–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞: Pipeline, Shared Libs, Jenkins Pipeline Unit, JobDSL ‚Ä¢ –¢–∏–º–æ—Ñ–µ–π –¢—É—Ä–µ–Ω–∫–æ, MariaDB - –û–± —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–µ MariaDB Maxscale - "–Ø —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É –æ –Ω–∞—à–µ–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è Jenkins –∏ Jenkins Job Builder + Vagrant –¥–ª—è —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏–∑ –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∫–æ–≤ –≤–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –º–∞—à–∏–Ω –∏ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–∞ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏". –ö–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞: Jenkins Job Builder, Vagrant, MDBCI (https://github.com/OSLL/mdbci) –°–±–æ—Ä –≤ 18:30, –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥ –Ω–∞—á–Ω–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ 19:00

name: Big Data & Data Science Community Meetup #11 (—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞)
description: –ß–µ–º –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è? –ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –ø–æ–π—Ç–∏ –≤ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –∫ –Ω–∞–ºüç≤ 30 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è –º—ã –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–º Big Data&Data Science Community Meetup (https://events.epam.com/events/big-data--data-science-community-10th-meetup) –¥–ª—è —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è Senior. –ù–∞—à–∏ –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä—ã –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏–ª–∏ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã, –∞ –≤—ã –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—å—Ç–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã. –õ–µ–≤ –•–∞—á–µ—Ä–µ—Å—å—è–Ω—Ü –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏—Ç —Å —Ç–µ–º–æ–π "–°—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∏–Ω–≥-–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑–µ Spark". –û–Ω —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∏–Ω–≥ –∏ Spark Structured Streaming, –∑–∞—á–µ–º –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –≤ –ï–†–ê–ú –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç —Å—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∏–Ω–≥ Spark. –ú–∏—Ö–∞–∏–ª –ú–∞—Ç–≤–µ–µ–≤ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏—Ç —Å –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–º "–ú–µ—Ç–æ–¥—ã IoT –¥–ª—è –¥–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è". –í—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ –æ–± IoT, –¥–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–º —Ä–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, –∞ –µ—â–µ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ ‚Äì –¥–µ–º–æ —Ä–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π –∏ –∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–π —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é IoT. –†–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞: https://events.epam.com/events/big-data--data-science-community-10th-meetup

description: –ú—ã —Ä–µ—à–∏–ª–∏ –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –æ—Ç –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞ "–Ω–∞ –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä—É" –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏—Å—å –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–º—É –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—É, –ô–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∞–Ω–∞ –õ–µ–≤–∏–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–æ, –∫–∞–∫ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º—É –±—É–¥—É—Ç —Ä–∞–¥—ã –≤ –ª—é–±–æ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏. –≠—Ç–æ—Ç –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥ –≤—ã–∑–≤–∞–ª –±—É—Ä–Ω—É—é —Ä–µ–∞–∫—Ü–∏—é —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ Mobius 2019 –∏ –º—ã —Ä–µ—à–∏–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—Å–∏—Ç—å —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–±–æ—Ä –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å –ô–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–º. –ö—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å? –ô–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∞–Ω –õ–µ–≤–∏–Ω, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –≤ monday.com, ex-GDE, –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–π, –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å Android Academy. –î–µ–Ω–∏—Å –ù–µ–∫–ª—é–¥–æ–≤, Android GDE, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫ –≤ Lyft. –ï–≤–≥–µ–Ω–∏–π –ö–æ—Ç, team lead, —á–ª–µ–Ω –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ö–æ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ HolyJS, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–∞ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏. –ò–≥–æ—Ä—å –õ—É–∫–∞–Ω–∏–Ω, Product Marketing Manager –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ JUG Ru Group, ex-devrel –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ö–æ–Ω—Ç—É—Ä. –ó–∞ –¥–≤–∞ —á–∞—Å–∞ –º—ã –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥, —É—Å–ª—ã—à–∏–º —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ —Å—á–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–≥–æ, –Ω—É –∏ –ø–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—á–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –∑—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π. ===== –ù–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–∞ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è :) ====== –†–∞–¥—ã –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –≤–∞—Å —Å –Ω–∞—à–µ–º Telegram ( https://t.me/wtmspb )! –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: GDG St. Petersburg –ù–∞—à–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è —Ü–µ–ª—å ‚Äî –¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è–º–∏. –ú—ã –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑—É–µ–º —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏—è, –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–∞–µ–º –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä—è–º–æ –∏–∑ Google, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –¥–∞—ë–º –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ª—é–±–æ–º—É —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫—É —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å —Å–µ–±—è –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä–∞. –ú—ã —Ö–æ—Ç–∏–º –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å –¥—Ä—É–∂–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ, –≥–¥–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —Å–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ –∏–¥–µ—è–º–∏ –∏ –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É –≤ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö. GDG St Petersburg —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ–π –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–æ–π; –ª—é–±—ã–µ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –∏ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö —ç—Ç–æ–π –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω—ã —Å –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π Google. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ GDG, –ø–æ—Å–µ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ https://developers.google.com/groups/ Our main purpose is sharing knowledge. We organize different events, invite Google engineers and, of course, give an opportunity to every gdg-er to try himself as a speaker. Also we want to build a strong community where everyone can share his ideas and find support for its implementation. GDG St. Petersburg is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. To learn more about the GDG program, visit https://developers.google.com/groups/

name: Webinar "DevSecOps for developers ‚Äî why it‚Äôs important and how to get started?"
description: Virtido invites everyone interested to take part in webinar "DevSecOps for developers ‚Äî why it‚Äôs important and how to get started?" We already know that DevOps is a mix of Development and Operations. Based on that knowledge we can assume that DecSecOps is a mix of Development, Security and Operations. But is it important for developers? And, if that‚Äôs the case, how to get started? Also, our topic will be interesting and helpful for DevOps Engineers. During our webinar we will find out: ‚óè what OWASP is, ‚óè what are the most common security risks, ‚óè how to protect your app from them and how to do it in a repeatable and reusable way. Our Speaker ‚Äî Anton Boyko. 15+ years in application development. Worked as Developer, DevOps and Architect. Currently occupies the role of the Senior Solution Architect at Valtech. Owner and one of the organizers of the most popular Microsoft Azure conferences in Ukraine: Azure Day and Global Azure Bootcamp. Language: Ukrainian Register for receiving an email with a link on the webinar: forms.gle/K9yQqLdXxyFUs19u6 Event on Facebook: www.facebook.com/events/716120045823702 See you online on May 18 at 19:00!

name: Webinar "Introducing to k6 load testing tool"
description: ‚è© –ü—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ Webinar: " Introducing to k6 load testing tool" —Å –≥–æ—Å—Ç–µ–º –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä–æ–º –ì–µ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–º ‚Äî —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –∂–∏–≤–µ—Ç –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –≤ –ì–æ–ª–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∏–∏. üí•–û–ø—ã—Ç –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä–∞ #Automation Engineer –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –æ–±—à–∏—Ä–Ω—ã–π. 24 –∏—é–Ω—è –≤ #Online –æ–Ω —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç –æ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º, –Ω–æ –º–æ—â–Ω–æ–º –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–µ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–æ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è: üí• #–ö6 ‚Äî –µ—â–µ –æ–¥–∏–Ω open source –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç —Å –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã–º –∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã–º –∫–æ–¥–æ–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç QA –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–∏—Ç—å –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫—É—é –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π. üí•–ú—ã –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏ –æ JMeter, Gatling —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ. –î–∞–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç #PerformanceTesting ‚Äî —á—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è –∞–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á. üìùAgenda: ‚úîÔ∏è–í–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ ‚úîÔ∏èScripting, Running and Monitoring Load Tests ‚úîÔ∏èIntegrates with CI/CD pipelines ‚úîÔ∏è–û–ø—ã—Ç –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ö6 üëÄ–î–ª—è –∫–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞—Ö—ñ–¥ –±—É–¥–µ —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–∏–º: üî∏Manual QA üî∏AQA üî∏Dev üì¢–°–ø—ñ–∫–µ—Ä: –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ì–µ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π Senior Software Engineer at Test at #DAZN üîó Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/vladimirgerastovskiy ‚ùóÔ∏è –í–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ‚ùóÔ∏è –°–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏–µ –Ω–∞ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–º. üëâ –†–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ª—è—Ü–∏—é –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å: forms.gle/R5wJFcYtabzHPB6e7 üì≤–ï—Å–ª–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ –≤ –º–µ—Å—Å–µ–Ω–¥–∂–µ—Ä—ã: +38 (099) 376 65 05, –∏–ª–∏ (098) 903 64 45 üìå C–∞–π—Ç: www.qagroup.com.ua üìå Youtube: bit.ly/QAGroupYoutube üìå Telegram: bit.ly/QAGroupTelegram üìå Instagram: bit.ly/QAGroupInstagram üìå LinkedIn: bit.ly/QAGroupLinkedIn üìå QAInfo: bit.ly/QAInfo

name: Big Data & Data Science Community meetup #14
Webinar: QAs role in a SCRUM environment
description: ‚è© Welcome to Webinar: QAs role in a SCRUM environment with our gust from Malta Andrea Borg ‚úîÔ∏èThere is so much confusion in the industry regarding what part QA Engineers should play in agile projects. Part of the problem is that the most popular Agile framework: Scrum ‚Äî says almost nothing about it. ‚úîÔ∏èThis talk will focus on explaining the importance and responsibilities of the QA role within a Scrum team. Some tips and tricks from personal experiences to smoothen your transition to a SCRUM QA Engineer. üìùAgenda: 1. The three pillars of SCRUM: Artefacts, Events, Roles 2. SCRUM ROLES: Where does the QA fit in 3. SCRUM Events: Participating in Planning and Refinements(groomings) meetings 4. SCRUM Artefacts: Sprint Backlog vs Team Backlog 5. What about automation? 6. Enforcing the DoD 7. Can a QA be a Scrum master? ü§ó Language: English üëâRegister for receiving an email with a link on the webinar: forms.gle/h6e2HBtMDn7SU9WG6 üé§ Speaker: Andrea Borg, Malta Experienced Senior QA Engineer Founder: testautonation.com üîó Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-borg üëâ–†–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è –¥–ª—è –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞–Ω–Ω—è –ª—ñ–Ω–∫—É –Ω–∞ –í–µ–±—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä: forms.gle/h6e2HBtMDn7SU9WG6 üì≤–©–æ–± –¥—ñ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç–∏—Å—å —â–µ –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª–µ–π —Ç–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω—É–π—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–æ–º: +38 (099) 376 65 05 –∞–±–æ (098) 903 64 45 üìå–Ü–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–π –ü–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–ª C–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Ç–∏: www.quality-assurance-group.com üìåC–∞–π—Ç –°–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Ç–∏: www.qagroup.com.ua

name: Webinar "Geo-diverse Team-building"
description: Technology keeps bringing significant opportunities to the world, and one of them ‚Äî the ability to collaborate with talent from anywhere. In the past, startuppers, entrepreneurs, and corporate executives were limited to building a local workforce. Today, however, more companies are increasingly finding new ways to engage remote teams. üåç Geo-diverse is a trend that is only going to grow, which is why companies need a practical way to set up their teams for success. But building a fully remote team is far from a walk in the park. What happens when your headquarters is based in San Francisco, and the team you‚Äôre building is in Ukraine? In Seattle, Portland, Lisbon, London or anywhere else in the world? Join us to learn: üîπ What do you need to build a geo-diverse team? üîπ What are the challenges you might face building a team in another country? üîπ Distributed team management in a time of crisis ‚Äî how to cope with it? üîπ How to set up a remote team for success? Speaker: üî∏ Carl Sverre ‚Äî Senior Director, Helios at MemSQL ‚Äî had a challenge in 2019: to build a team in Ukraine in one month. Spoiler: it went successfully. Today, Carl is up to a new challenge: hiring in Seattle, San Francisco, Lisbon, and keep on building the Kyiv-based team. What lessons did he learn building a distributed team? MemSQL ‚Äî Graduated from Y-Combinator in winter of 2011, it is now the world‚Äôs fastest SQL database with total funding $158.1M. üìç Join us live on Facebook ‚Äî www.facebook.com/events/563864104340737 ‚Äî We will share a video when the event starts! üóì Add it to your calendar ‚Äî shorturl.at/dhnR8

name: Android Development and Beyond: CI/CD for mobile & Chromecast
description: –í—Å–µ–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ù–∏ –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–∞ –±–µ–∑ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–∞! –ù–∞ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑ –º—ã –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–µ—â–∞—Ö, –∞ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ CI/CD –¥–ª—è –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∏ —Ç–æ, –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å Chromecast. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É 27 –º–∞—Ä—Ç–∞ –º—ã –≤—Å–µ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–º—Å—è –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ EPAM (–Ω–∞ –õ–µ–≤–∞—à–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–µ) –∏ –æ–±—Å—É–¥–∏–º —ç—Ç–∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ–º—ã. –í –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ 2 –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞. –°–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –í–æ–≤–∞ –ò–≤–∞–Ω–æ–≤ –∏–∑ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ EPAM —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ CI/CD –≤ –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ: "Mobile CI/CD in 2K19" We all use CI/CD pipelines nowadays. But do we do it consciously? What actual problems do CI/CD pipelines solve? What exactly do we want from them? As Software Development is a complex process, so the building, checking and deployment processes are. In this talk we are considering the requirements for CI/CD systems, how it helps us build a better software, deliver more business value in less time and do all of that efficiently. The talk has some mobile specific but the overall approach is applied to almost any technology domain. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–µ—Ä–≤–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø–µ—á–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏ –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π–¥–µ–º –∫–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º—É –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—É –æ—Ç –ö–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ö—É–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞ –∏–∑ MobileUp. "–ö–∞–∫ –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–∂–∏—Ç—å Chromecast –∏ media player –≤ Android" –í –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —á–∏—Å–ª–æ Android TV –∏ Chromecast –¥–µ–≤–∞–π—Å–æ–≤. –ê–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –º–µ–¥–∏–∞-—Å—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∏–Ω–≥–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤—Å–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –∞–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Ç–µ–º–æ–π. –Ø —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É, –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç Chromecast, –∏ —Å –∫–∞–∫–∏–º–∏ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∫–Ω—É—Ç—å—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏ –µ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è 27 –º–∞—Ä—Ç–∞ –≤ 19:00! ===== –ö–û–õ–ò–ß–ï–°–¢–í–û –ú–ï–°–¢ –û–ì–†–ê–ù–ò–ß–ï–ù–û! (–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥ –ø–æ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞–º). –° —Å–æ–±–æ–π —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –≤–∑—è—Ç—å –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã –¢–û–ß–ù–û –ø–æ–ø–∞—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ, –Ω–∞–∂–º–∏—Ç–µ RSVP :) ====== –í—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤ –Ω–∞—à Telegram (https://t.me/gdgspb) –∏ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—Å—É—â–Ω—ã–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ.

description: –í—Å–µ–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ü—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–∞–µ–º –≤ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ Return on Intelligence –Ω–∞ DevOps Smart Talk. –†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏–µ Continuous Delivery –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ –≤ —Å–º–µ—à–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö Cloud-Native –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö (–≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏—Ç –Ω–∞—à –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∞ –∏–∑ –ù–∏–∂–Ω–µ–≥–æ –ù–æ–≤–≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–∞), –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ –æ–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è ChatOps –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –∏–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ ROI. –¢–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –æ–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è DevOps –∏ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º—É–º —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–∏, —É—é—Ç–Ω–∞—è –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞, —á–∞–π/–∫–æ—Ñ–µ –∏ –ø–µ—á–µ–Ω—å–µ, ‚Äì —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º—ã –æ–±–µ—â–∞–µ–º –≤–∞–º –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–µ. –ü—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è–π—Ç–µ—Å—å! –ü–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ: https://returnonintelligence.timepad.ru/event/490924/

name: Meetup #6
description: The agenda is as follows: 1. Solving The Allen AI Science Challenge (https://www.kaggle.com/c/the-allen-ai-science-challenge) and hacking DeepHack Q&A hackathon (http://qa.deephack.me/): what did work and what didn't. Talks from the teams: Generation Gap (Challenge 7th, DeepHack 1st) and 5vision (Challenge 8th, DeepHack 2nd). 2. Development-driven analytics: How to optimize data-mining processes and cluster resources for online advertisement. Mikhail Erofeev, Segmento 3. [masked]: collaborative and hybrid recommender systems at OK.ru are based on a flexible data structure ‚Äì taste graph, and a well-known algorithm ‚Äì personalized page rank. In the talk we are going to describe how to build the taste graph, how to evaluate its performance, how to integrate it into production and what are the benefits of the taste graph comparing to common similarity- and factorization-based techniques. Dmitry Bugaychenko, OK.ru Please welcome!

name: Smart Talks 213: Microsoft SharePoint

name: Svitla Smart Talk: Call Center Talks Analyzer built with the Azure cloud
description: Today with great pleasure we announce the first Svila webinar hosted by a foreign speaker ‚Äî Daniel Krzyczkowski, Software Developer at Predica Group and Microsoft MVP. On 18th August he will walk you through the solution to get insights related to recorded call center talks including chat messages and recorded audio-video conversations entirely built on the Azure cloud. He will discuss services (like Azure Function or Video Indexer) used together with some business aspects of the project. The demo will cover implementation details together with the end-to-end process from uploading the file to the end Power BI report. Source code repository together with instructions will be available to all attendees. Speaker Daniel-Krzyczkowski is a Software Engineer passionate about Microsoft technologies. Awarded with Microsoft Most Valuable Professional title, he actively shares his knowledge of Microsoft Azure, IoT, Universal Windows Platform and DevSecOps. Pluralsight author, Daniel runs a technical blog: www.techmindfactory.com and often shares code samples on github.com/Daniel-Krzyczkowski ‚ùóÔ∏èEvent details: Date: 18th August, 7 PM (Kyiv timezone, GMT+3) Duration: 1.5 hour (60 minutes lecture and Q&A session) Language: English! Level: Middle and Senior Developers Registration is free but compulsory. Details will be sent after free registration. Registration ‚Äî 2event.com/events/1859550 FB event ‚Äî www.facebook.com/events/980229795758575

name: Post I/O: Firebase, etc.
description: –ú–µ—Å—è—Ü –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ –≤ Mountain View –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–∏–ª—Å—è Google I/O, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ. –ú—ã —É–∂–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏–∑ –º–∏—Ä–∞ Android –∏ —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —Ä–µ—à–∏–ª–∏ –∑–∞—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω—É—Ç—å —Ç–µ–º—É Firebase —Å MLKit, Android Go –∏ Android Wear. –ò—Ç–∞–∫, –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ: * "Android Go - –∑–∞—á–µ–º –º–Ω–µ –æ–Ω–æ?" –ü–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ Android Go, –∫–∞–∫ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫ —ç—Ç–æ–π –û–°, –∏ –≤ –∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö —Å–ª—É—á–∞—è—Ö –ª—É—á—à–µ –ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –ê—Ä—Ç—É—Ä –í–∞—Å–∏–ª–æ–≤, Yandex & GDG SPB & KUG SPB. * Android Wear –ü–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –ø—Ä–æ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø–æ–¥ Wear OS, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏—è –æ—Ç –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã –∏ –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç —Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å –Ω–æ—Å–∏–º–æ–π —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∫–æ–π –ö–æ–Ω—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–Ω –ö—É–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤, MobileUp * Machine Learning Kit with Firebase During this talk we are going to introduce ML Kit: a new way to bring powerful machine learning features to your app whether it's for Android or iOS, and whether you're an experienced machine learning developer or you're just getting started. Laura Morinigo (Firebase), Google Developer Expert in Firebase, entrepreneur and mentor –ù—É —á—Ç–æ –∂, –∂–¥–µ–º –≤–∞—Å —É–∂–µ –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ —á–µ–º —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—é!

description: –ü–æ–∫–∞ –≤—Å–µ —Å –Ω–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–ø–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∂–¥—É—Ç –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–æ–≤ - –º—ã –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–µ–º —Å–µ—Ä–∏—é –≤–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–≤. –¢–µ–º –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –æ–Ω–∏ –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–∑ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –≤ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–π –¥–ª—è –Ω–∞—Å —Å –≤–∞–º–∏ —Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–µ. –ù–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–∞ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è - https://ibmdbg.timepad.ru/event/1323569/ –ù–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–º —Å–µ–º–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–µ –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –º–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä-–∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∞ –í—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ –∫–∞–∫ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –∫–ª–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä Openshift –∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –≤ IBM Cloud –∏ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã –¥–ª—è —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤–∞—à–∏—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π. –û—Ç –∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –≤ github –¥–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–µ OpenShift –∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç! –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞ –º–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä-–∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∞: –í–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ Red Hat Openshift Container Platform (OCP) –ö—Ä–∞—Ç–∫–∏–π —ç–∫—Å–∫—É—Ä—Å –≤ IBM Cloud, –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º—ã –≥—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ü–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ ROKS (RedHat Openshift on Kubernetes Services) ‚Äî —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º–∞—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ OCP –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞–∫–µ IBM Cloud –ö–≤–∏–∑ –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞: –í–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ to Red Hat OpenShift 4.3 –≤ IBM Cloud (–í—ã —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ —Å–≤–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–µ Openshift –∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç) –ò–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç–æ—Ä: –í–∞–ª–µ—Ä–∏–π –ö–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–µ–Ω–∫–æ –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Enterprise containers, clusters and service mesh Group about events for developer and DevOps from companies which use containers, orchestration and service mesh(specially Istio). Main topics - Docker, Kubernetes and Istio. Our main communication channel - telegram. Join - https://t.me/eecontainer

name: Webinar | Surviving the Enterprise
description: Join us on August 19 (6 PM EEST) to find the answers on how to survive the enterprise. We will talk about how you can survive in a world where positions are different, but responsibilities are similar (just times 2). During the webinar, we‚Äôll talk about: ‚Äî What is an enterprise? ‚Äî In this dynamic world, how can a business analysis survive in a corporation? ‚Äî How can a BA become a BA2? About the speaker: Ivan Anguelov is a Business Analyst with multi-domain experience in such as Transport Management, Automotive, Gaming, e-Commerce, Healthcare, Insurance. Currently working as Solution Architect in DHL Enterprise Software Solutions and responsible for the development of transport management systems. Registration: bit.ly/31Auy1a The webinar would be interesting for all BAs, product owners, and those who do all business analysis related work regardless of the title. It will be held in ENGLISH. Our event is free, but registration is required: bit.ly/31Auy1a Event page at FB: facebook.com/events/426452848272294

name: DevOps Meetup
description: –í—Å–µ–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–≥–æ —á–∏—Å–ª–∞ –∏–≤–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –º—ã —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä—è–µ–º –≥–æ—Ä–∏–∑–æ–Ω—Ç—ã –∏ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω DevOps! –ü—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —É –Ω–∞—Å –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–≤–∞ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞. ================================================================= –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥: "The road to Kubernetes" Come and learn about the history of Kubernetes from Google, and a little about the future of the platform –°–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä: Craig Box, Google Craig is an advocate & field product lead for Google Cloud. His job is spreading the message of our platforms, collecting customer feedback on rough edges, and then working with the engineers until they are smoothed! He started his career as a systems administrator, and has worked in development, deployment, DevOps, consulting, advisory and management roles. ================================================================= –í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥: "–†–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ DevOps –≤ –°–±–µ—Ä—Ç–µ—Ö–µ" –î–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω –æ–±–∑–æ—Ä—É –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–¥–∞ –∫ DevOps –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—É –≤ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –∏ –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –¶–µ–ª–µ–≤–∞—è –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è - —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–π —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ã, —Å–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤. –¶–µ–ª—å –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –ª—é–¥—è–º –æ —Ç–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å –∏–¥–µ–∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º, –∫–∞–∫ –≤–ª–∏—è—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –≤–∑–≥–ª—è–¥—ã. –ü–æ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–º—É —Å—Ç–µ–∫—É –ü–û - Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, SonarQube, Nexus, Maven. –•–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å –±—ã –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏—Å—å –ø–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π –≤ —Ç–æ–º –≤–∏–¥–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å–±–µ—Ä—Ç–µ—Ö–µ. –°–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä: –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –®–∞—Ä–∞–ø–æ–≤, –°–±–µ—Ä–±–∞–Ω–∫-–¢–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ ================================================================= –ú–∏—Ç–∞–ø –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü-—Ö–æ–ª–ª–µ Selectel –ø–æ –∞–¥—Ä–µ—Å—É –¶–≤–µ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∞—è, 19. ================================================================= –ö–û–õ–ò–ß–ï–°–¢–í–û –ú–ï–°–¢ –û–ì–†–ê–ù–ò–ß–ï–ù–û! (–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥ –ø–æ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞–º). –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã –¢–û–ß–ù–û –ø–æ–ø–∞—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ, –Ω–∞–∂–º–∏—Ç–µ –∑–µ–ª–µ–Ω—É—é –≥–∞–ª–æ—á–∫—É –∏–ª–∏ RSVP, —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –∫–∞–∫–æ–π —É –≤–∞—Å –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω :) ================================================================= –í—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤ –Ω–∞—à Slack ( https://gdgspb.herokuapp.com/ ) –∏–ª–∏ Telegram ( https://t.me/gdgspb ) –∏ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—Å—É—â–Ω—ã–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –∏ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ =)

description: HashiCorp User Group Saint-Petersburg (HUG-SPB) ‚Äì –Ω–µ–∫–æ–º–º–µ—Ä—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ DevOps —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤, –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—â–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç—ã HashiCorp, –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–π –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–µ–π –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∏–∑—ã, –≤—ã—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö DevOps —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ HashiCorp. –û–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—å—Å–∫–∏–µ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω—ã –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º—É –∏–∑ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –≤–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –æ—Ç HashiCorp ‚Äî Terraform. –ù–µ —É—Å–ø–µ–ª–∏ –ø–æ—É–ª–µ—á—å—Å—è —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ç –Ω–∞—Å—ã—â–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∏ –ø–ª–æ–¥–æ—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–Ω–æ–π –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏, –∞ –≤–æ—Ç –≤–∞–º –∞–Ω–æ–Ω—Å —É–∂–µ –¥–ª—è —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–π! –ù–∞ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑ —É –Ω–∞—Å —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –≥–æ—Å—Ç—å ‚Äî –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ Terraform - –†–∞–¥–µ–∫ –°–∏–º–∫–æ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–æ–π!!! –†–∞–¥–µ–∫ –õ–ò–ß–ù–û —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ –æ—Ä–∫–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤ –≤ Kubernetes —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Terraform, –∏, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –∂–µ, –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç–∏—Ç –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞—Å—É—â–Ω—ã–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –ø—Ä–æ –æ–¥–Ω—É –∏–∑ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ç—É–ª–æ–≤ –æ—Ç HashiCorp. –î–∞—Ç–∞ –∏ –í—Ä–µ–º—è: 19 –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—è 2017 –≥–æ–¥–∞, —Å 19:00-22:00 –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –º–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–µ –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ: –û—Ñ–∏—Å –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ SEMrush, –°–ü–±, —É–ª. –ó–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤—Å–∫–∞—è, 22–ê (10 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –ø–µ—à–∫–æ–º –æ—Ç —Å—Ç. –º. –ú–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–µ –≤–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∞), –í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π —ç—Ç–∞–∂. –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: –í–∞–º –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –∑–∞–π—Ç–∏ –≤ —Ö–æ–ª–ª –±/—Ü –ú–µ–≥–∞–ø–∞—Ä–∫ –∏ –ø–æ–¥–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–æ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–π –ª–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü–µ –Ω–∞ 2-–π —ç—Ç–∞–∂. –°–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ –æ—Ç –ª–∏—Ñ—Ç–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–≤–µ—Ä—å —Å —Ç–∞–±–ª–∏—á–∫–æ–π SEMrush ‚Äî –í–∞–º —Ç—É–¥–∞‚ò∫ 19:30-20:15 "Terraforming the Kubernetes Land (https://www.hashiconf.com/talks/radek-simko.html)" Radek Simko, Terraform Developer, HashiCorp 20:15 ‚Äî 20:45 ‚Äî –ü–µ—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤, –Ω–µ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ, —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π 20:45-21:30 ‚Äî –û—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∞—è –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏—è, –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã 21:30 ‚Äî 22:00 ‚Äî –ù–µ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∑–∞–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏–µ –º–µ—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏—è 22:00 ‚Äî –¥–æ –ø–æ–±–µ–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ ‚Äî after party. –í—Å–µ–º, –∫–æ–º—É –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∏–ª–æ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è, –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏–º –≤ —É—é—Ç–Ω–æ–º –±–∞—Ä–µ –Ω–µ–ø–æ–¥–∞–ª—ë–∫—É:-) –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–µ, –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–∞ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è: https://hug-spb.timepad.ru/event/591641/

name: Svitla Smart Talk: Host and Deploy .NET Core App to Microsoft Azure
description: If you are interested in how to host and deploy .NET Core App to Microsoft Azure join this webinar on the 30th of July. Igor Fesenko will walk you through all steps required to take your application to the Cloud. All proposed techniques and practices are cloud-agnostic and reference implementation will target Azure Cloud and .NET Core. So join us and learn more about Igor‚Äòs set of favorite practices and tools that allow you to streamline the experience of creating & managing infrastructure, then building & deploying your app to the infrastructure. Speaker Igor Fesenko ‚Äî Application Architect at SoftServe Inc. and Microsoft ¬Æ Most Valuable Professional. He is passionate about designing and developing distributed, scalable and secure web applications and cloud-enabled solutions. Proficient in C# & Microsoft Azure, has managed and assessed multiple projects focusing on high performance and large data solutions, taking advantage of all the features and capabilities available on a target platform. His current focus is on the building and improvement of scalable and secure web applications, cloud-enabled applications and operations. Igor is also a contributor to a number of Open Source projects and a speaker at local and international technical conferences, meetups and user groups. twitter.com/Ky7m www.linkedin.com/in/ifesen Event details: Date ‚Äî 30 July at 19:00. Duration ‚Äî 1.5 h. (1 hour. ‚Äî lection, 30 min. ‚Äî Q&A session) Language: Russian All other details we will send after registration. Registration is free but compulsory. Facebook event ‚Äî www.facebook.com/events/708950909939787 Registration ‚Äî 2event.com/events/1859317

name: –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ CI/CD –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ö: Jenkins, Teamcity –∏ Atlassian Bamboo
description: –≠—Ç–æ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –º–µ—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—à—É –∑–∞—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–π—Ç–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –Ω–∞–∂–∞–≤ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç—É —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫—É (https://aug.atlassian.com/events/details/atlassian-st-petersburg-presents-segodnia-pogovorim-o-cicd-instrumentakh-jenkins-teamcity-i-atlassian-bamboo). –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º –æ CI/CD –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ö: Jenkins, Teamcity –∏ Atlassian Bamboo –ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç –≤—Å–µ–º! –í —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –¥–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ—Å–ª—É—à–∞–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ CI/CD –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã. –í—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞ –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏–º, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω—ã–º —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º –∏ –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–º —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ Bamboo, Jenkins, TeamCity. –î–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—á–∏–∫–∏ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ War Stories. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–≤ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –æ–±—â–∏–π Q&A –∏ –¥–ª—è –∂–µ–ª–∞—é—â–∏—Ö after-party. –ü–æ –∏—Ç–æ–≥—É —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–º —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–º –æ—Ç –∏–º–µ–Ω–∏ community –≤ Atlassian. –ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤—å—Ç–µ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã (: –ü–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞ aug.atlassian.com (https://aug.atlassian.com/st-petersburg/) –î–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã: ‚Ä¢ –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –§–∏–ª–∞—Ç–æ–≤, Epam, "Zero-Downtime –¥–µ–ø–ª–æ–π–º–µ–Ω—Ç —Å–æ –≤–∫—É—Å–æ–º –ê–º–∞–∑–æ–Ω–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–≤". –ù–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–µ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ —è —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É, –∫–∞–∫ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å Zero-Downtime CD —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º AWS ECS ‚Ä¢ –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –ú–∞—Ä–∫–µ–ª–æ–≤, –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫ Atlassian –ø–ª–∞–≥–∏–Ω–æ–≤. –°–ü–±, "Jenkins Pipelines: –£–¥–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –∏ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è". –°–∫–∞–∑ –æ —Ç–æ–º –∫–∞–∫ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å CI/CD , –∏ –∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –∏ –∫–∏—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–∂–∏—Ç—å —Å –º–∏—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–æ–º –≤ –≥–∞–ª—Å—Ç—É–∫–µ-–±–∞–±–æ—á–∫–µ, –∏ –∫–∞–∫–∏–º–∏ –∏—Ö —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å –±—ã –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –≤ Bamboo. ‚Ä¢ –ì–æ–Ω—á–∏–∫ –¶—ã–º–∂–∏—Ç–æ–≤, Atlassian Administrator, –°–ü–ë, "Atlassian Bamboo: –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –∏ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞". –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ–∏—á–∏ –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∫–∏ —Å –ø—Ä–∏—Ü–µ–ª–æ–º –Ω–∞ –∏—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è. –û—Ñ–∏—Å EPAM —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä—è–µ—Ç—Å—è, –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞, –Ω–µ –ø—É–≥–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞ 7 —ç—Ç–∞–∂–µ :) –î–æ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞! name: Remote coding kata (joint event with Berlin Community)
description: Let us participate in a Coding Dojo organized by our Berlin friends. To have a nice experience, please have the following tools prepared in advance of the event. name: Thirst-Quenching Streams for the Reactive Mind
description: Dear passionate developers, surprises keep on coming! üìÖ For June we have a special event planned together with the amazing Mary Grygleski (Developer Advocate @ IBM Global Java Advocacy). Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to participate to her insightful presentations! With the advances in multicore hardware and virtualization technologies, and the demand for highly responsive, resilient, and elastic systems and increasingly sophisticated applications, an array of reactive data stream processing libraries have been born to address the ever-increasing needs. Reactive Streams is an initiative to provide a standard for asynchronous stream processing with non-blocking back pressure. This encompasses efforts aimed at run-time environments that include JVM and Javascript, as well as network protocols. üìö So how do the various library implementations of Reactive Streams, such as Spring Reactor, Reactive Extension (Rx)'s Observables, and RSocket, stack up against each other? Here is our agenda for the event: ‚òëÔ∏è This presentation will go into some details on how streams leverage on the underlying multicore processor to achieve parallelism. ‚òëÔ∏è It will then explain the push vs the pull streaming model. ‚òëÔ∏è Afterwards, it will use a simple use case with code examples to illustrate the different API usages, as well as run-time processing analysis between a few popular Java implementations of Reactive Streams. üé§ Our speaker is Mary Grygleski, who is currently a Java Developer Advocate at IBM, specializing in Reactive Java and distributed systems. She started working as a software engineer with C and Unix, then got into Java, Open Source, and web development in the new Millennium, and now she is venturing into Reactive, Mobile, and the DevOps space. In her previous incarnations, she worked for several technology product companies in the Route 128 Boston Technology Corridor as well the San Francisco Bay Area. She now resides in the Greater Chicago area, and is the President and Executive Board Member of the Chicago Java Users Group (CJUG). She is also an active co-organizers for the Data, Cloud and AI In Chicago, Chicago Cloud, and IBM Cloud Chicago meetup groups. Mary continues to be amazed by how software innovations can dramatically transform our lives. Despite the many challenges in an ever-evolving technical world, she gets energized by the constant change and believes that she has uncovered the pathway to staying young. She can't wait to see what the next tech wave will be like. üß†Let's all explore our reactive minds! Please make sure you join the event on the meetup group, as we are going to share the webinar link two days prior to the event to those who are registered for it üòâ! –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: IBM Developer Moscow Join us if you are interested in cloud computing, cognitive technology, IoT, NodeJs, Javascript, Blockchain or open source software development.

name: Startup Ecosystem Rankings 2020 - Launch Webinar
description: We believe that where you choose to build your startup will have drastic effects on its success. In this webinar, StartupBlink will unveil the 2020 Global Ecosystem Report, the world's most comprehensive report ranking the top 100 countries and 1000 cities before the official release. Making you one of the first to know the official results and see where your cities and countries rank. This event is also a celebration with Ecosystem Developers around the world featuring their ecosystems giving you ideas on where to move and invest. *** Mark your attendance here (top-right of the page), then register using this link, spaces are limited https://webinar.startupblink.com/ This will be the third year of the Startup Ecosystem Rankings report, which was first released in 2017. Since then, our rankings have supported thousands of decision makers in designing their strategies as and has been featured by dozens of media outlets around the world and acknowledged by top government officials. - Find out how your city and country are ranked in the Startup Ecosystem Rankings 2019 report of over 1000 cities and 100 countries around the world! - Know key insights about certain ecosystems from a variety of startup ecosystem developers - Know the key results and insights from the Coronavirus Innovation Rankings from the Coronavirus Innovation Map by StartupBlink, HIEx by UNAIDS, and Moscow Agency of Innovations. - Discover the latest trends: What cities are emerging in the startup scene? What are the best locations to set up a startup? Which regions have a great startup ecosystem? - Understand the rankings methodology and what factors influenced them - Promote your ecosystem! We will open the floor to everyone for a marathon of city/country presentations. It‚Äôs your unique opportunity to promote your local ecosystem to the world - Apply through the link below to join the panel with a 1-2 min presentation of your startup ecosystem https://webinar.startupblink.com/ - - - About the speaker Eli David is co-founder and CEO of StartupBlink, a global startup ecosystem map, and research center. StartupBlink ranks the ecosystems of 1,000 cities and 100 countries and releases an annual report read by tens of thousands of decision-makers and featured in hundreds of magazines. Eli is an MBA, CPA consulting dozens of public sector organizations about the development of their startup ecosystem. - - - –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82865675883 –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Moscow Startup Ecosystem by StartupBlink Do you want to meet like-minded entrepreneurs? Grow your project? And even find co-founders or partners? Join this startup meetup group! This meetup facilitates casual networking events, startup lectures, and weekly online pitching events. We also feature events offered by the community (that‚Äôs you!). Partner with us Would you like to take a key role in this meetup, and brand your organization as a leader of your local startup ecosystem? StartupBlink invites founders, accelerators, coworking spaces and leading startup organizations to become StartupBlink City Partners. This partnership comes with benefits that include a feature in our annual reports, global startup ecosystem map and all 90 of our meetups around the world, including this one. Click here to learn more: https://citypartner.startupblink.com/ Our activities - "Weekend Coffee" networking initiative is happening in dozens of cities around the world. This is your chance to make new connections, share advice, and brainstorm with like-minded entrepreneurs. The events are led by volunteers and our City Partners. If you would like to help organizing those events, feel free to reach us at meetup@startupblink.com - "Startup Pitching Online" is our flagship weekly webinar happening on Wednesdays. Here you can pitch your startup and get feedback from our expert mentors and dozens of entrepreneurs. And if you do not feel like pitching yet, join us to watch other pitches (who knows, maybe this will be a stepping stone to build an extraordinary startup project and prepare for your own future pitch?) What is StartupBlink? StartupBlink is a global startup ecosystem map and research center. You can add your startup, coworking space or organization for free: https://www.startupblink.com/startups/moscow+russia StartupBlink runs 90 local Meetup chapters with over 50,000 entrepreneurs globally. In addition, StartupBlink is ranking the startup ecosystems of over 100 countries and 1,000 cities, in a report downloaded by tens of thousands of decision makers. Here is a link to download our latest annual report and find out where your city and country are ranked: https://report.startupblink.com StartupBlink works with dozens of municipalities and government organizations to develop and promote their local startup ecosystems. If you are a public sector ecosystem developer, let‚Äôs work together: https://ecosystempartnership.startupblink.com - - - This group is partnered with Findexable - researching fintech companies around the world and publishing the first real-time ranking of all cities where there‚Äôs a cluster of fintech companies https://findexable.com/ - - - All meetups are hosted in accordance with the terms of use posted on https://www.startupblink.com/blog/terms-conditions/

name: UiPath Test Suite: Mobile Automation: Virtual Meetup
description: Hello UiPath Community, Second most wanted virtual meetup is here: UiPath Test suite: Mobile Automation! Register for the session here: https://bit.ly/UiPathTestSuite . As soon as the sun shines and we struggle to wake up, the first thing we all need is our smartphone - even before we brush our teeth. People are consumed with their smartphones 24/7 and very rarely use a desktop computer for online activities. Businesses are making the best use of this opportunity by adopting a Mobile First strategy to rapidly expand their business. As such, applications are designed and launched for mobile devices before they are scaled up for larger display devices. This approach also requires a different testing strategy. Different network speeds, various input types, call interruptions, responsive design, and many other factors need to be considered in assessing the quality of mobile apps through test automation. Christian Mayer (Director, Product Management) https://www.linkedin.com/in/christian-mayer-2a26b112a/ will share how the UiPath Test Suite helps you to create resilient automated tests for your mobile apps and how to integrate your mobile testing strategy into your broader testing strategy. Please join the virtual meetup here: https://uipath.zoom.us/j/96825515813 Let‚Äôs virtually meet (again)! Luiza & the UiPath Community team –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://uipath.zoom.us/j/96825515813 –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: UiPath RPA Saint Petersburg An online and offline environment where RPA developers or enthusiasts: - meet each other - share about the challenges they encounter, learn together - build projects and components together Share your experiences and hear from others what worked for them and where they failed. See demonstrations of what is possible today and hear what will be possible in the future through integration with AI, DL, ML, etc. We will be inviting UiPath RPA developers and organisations who are already working on UiPath RPA projects to share experiences on various topics around RPA, the business cases, the platforms, the strategy, the skills needed to be successful, governance, HR concerns, and the future scope of RPA technologies - i.e. the important things needed to get started and be successful. We aim to meet ideally monthly. If you are interested in presenting a subject, contact us so we can schedule you at one of our upcoming meet ups. P.S. Check out UiPath Connect! the open network of passionate people and companies interested in RPA - http://bit.ly/2MZCRMn Check our T&C. ( https://bit.ly/2tps9FL )

name: Sitecore User Group Belarus ‚Äî online meetup
description: Sitecore Community in Belarus welcomes you to join us for the first online SUG Belarus Meetup that will be held on May 13th (Wednesday) at 18:00. Speakers and agenda: ‚Äî Vadzim Papko, Sitecore MVP & enthusiast @ SaM Solutions, #SitecoreJSS and #SitecoreSXA together. Is It Real? First experience! After the great ultimate showdown (SXA vs. JSS: Ultimate Showdown) on Global Virtual SUGCON 2020 , JSS evangelist Anastasiya Flynn tweeted: "Yes! #SitecoreJSS and #SitecoreSXA are most flexible/powerful when used together." twitter.com/.../1255949425450631176?s=20 That is absolutely true! In this session I will share our first implementation experience where we have been using JSS and SXA together. ‚Äî Volodymyr Hil, Solutions Architect and Sitecore MVP @ Pintle ApS The power of Sitecore configurations A technical deep dive session which will cover the overview of Sitecore configuration possibilities, differences and best practices in configuration across Sitecore platform versions, details on Sitecore 9 configuration improvements, custom usage of Sitecore configuration factory and its powerful capabilities with demo and lots of examples. ‚Äî Sergey Baranov, Sitecore Technology MVP @ Brimit Churn Prediction with Sitecore Cortex Customer churn, also known as customer attrition, occurs when customers stop doing business with a company. The companies are interested in identifying segments of these customers because the price for acquiring a new customer is usually higher than retaining the old one. I will introduce you to different approaches to solving this problem and of course show a demo how it can be implemented and works in real solutions. Sorry, no pizza this time. But you‚Äôll get a chance to win a Resharper license! More information: www.meetup.com/...Belarus/events/270334524

description: –ù–∞ —á–µ—Ç–≤—ë—Ä—Ç–æ–º –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–µ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø—è—Ç: –ê–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω –ê–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –ö–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç —Ñ–∏–∑–∏–∫–æ-–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞—É–∫ ggplot2 v2.0 –∏ –¥—Ä—É–∑—å—è –ü–æ–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —Å–∞–º—É—é –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—É—é –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—É R. –†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∏ –º–∞–ª–æ–∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ–≥–æ. –ü–æ–∫–∞–∂—É, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –µ—â—ë –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç—ã —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –¥—Ä—É–∂–∞—Ç —Å ggplot2. –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä –®–ª–µ–º–æ–≤ –°–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫ –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞ –ê–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –ë–∏–æ—Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –°–ü–±–ì–£ –û–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ-–æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ R –†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É –æ–± –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è—Ö –û–û–ü –≤ R (S3, S4, proto) –∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∂—É –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã –∫–æ–¥–∞ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –í–æ–ª–æ—Ö–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –°–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç –ø–æ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è–º, Wargaming SPb data.table: —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –Ω–µ–ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –¥–ª—è —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –†–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ R –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–ª–æ –∫ –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é –≤ –Ω—ë–º —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞—Ç—å "–¥–∏–∞–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏" - –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç—ã dplyr, data.table –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Å–æ–±–æ–π –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á, –∞ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω—É –±–∞–∑–æ–≤–æ–º—É —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Å–∏—Å—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏. –í —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–º –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–µ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –æ—Å–≤–µ—â–µ–Ω—ã –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–∏–∞–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞ data.table. –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Ç–æ—á–µ–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞—Ö –≤ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏, —Å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º–∏ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∫–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –¢–∏–º—É—Ä –®–µ—Ñ–µ—Ä –î–æ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –º–µ–¥–∏—Ü–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞—É–∫ –ê–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –∫–∏–Ω–µ—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–º–æ–≥–æ —Ç–æ—Ä–º–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ñ–µ—Ä–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ R –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏–µ ‚Äî –Ω–µ–ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω–∞—è —Ä–µ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏—è (–Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–µ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö), –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏ –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –í—Ä–µ–º—è –æ—Ç –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –±—É–¥—É—Ç —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω—ã –æ—Ç–≤–ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç R, –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è—é—â–∏–µ –∞–∑—ã —Ñ–µ—Ä–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –∫–∏–Ω–µ—Ç–∏–∫–∏. –ó–∞—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ spbr-4 –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ: https://spbr.timepad.ru/event/326533/ –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ —Ç–µ–º–∞–º –≤ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–µ https://vk.com/spbrug ----------- The fourth meetup has the following lineup: Anton Antonov Aleksandr Shlemov Vladimir Volokhonsky Timur Schafer Please register using the link https://spbr.timepad.ru/event/326533/ More information in our group https://vk.com/spbrug

–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –≤–µ–∑–¥–µ. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –Ω–µ–¥–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–ª–ª–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Å–æ–±–æ–π –∫–æ—à–º–∞—Ä –≤ –æ—Ç–ª–∞–¥–∫–µ, –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ –∂–µ—Å—Ç–∫–∏—Ö SLA. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é, –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∏–∑ –Ω–∏—Ö –æ–ø–∏—Ä–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –û–°, –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑—É—é—Ç —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å (—Ç–∞–∫ –Ω–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–µ green threads). –ú—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è, –∫–∞–∫ concurrency, multithreading, multitasking, parallelism, core, processor, thread, process, green thread. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –º—ã —É–≤–∏–¥–∏–º, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–∞—é—Ç –ø—Ä–∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã—Ö –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–µ–º—ã –¥–ª—è –∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–æ–¥–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è. –û—Å–æ–±–æ–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —É–¥–µ–ª–∏–º lock-free —Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–≤, –∞ –Ω–∞–ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–∫ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏—è –∞—Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ú–∏—Ç–∞–ø –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω, –≤ Zoom, —Å —Ä–µ–∑–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ª—è—Ü–∏–µ–π –≤ youtube. –°—Å—ã–ª–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—é –ü–ª–∞–Ω –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–∞: –¢–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω—ã, –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è –ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–µ–º—ã Lock-free synchronization –ê—Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å vs –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ú–∏—Ç–∞–ø –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ Sam Solutions. –ò–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä -
