name: RubyConfBY 2020 Online
description: 18-19 –∏—é–ª—è SPACE —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ —Å —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º Minsk.rb –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑—É—é—Ç RubyConfBY - 6-—É—é –µ–∂–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—É—é –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—é, –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —è–∑—ã–∫—É Ruby, Rails –∏ —Å–º–µ–∂–Ω—ã–º —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è–º. –í —ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω –∏ –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–≤—É—Ö–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–æ–π (1 –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫, 15:00-19:00 GMT+3) , —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –¥–µ–Ω—å –∏ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ —Ñ–∏—á–∞–º–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –±—ã–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω—ã –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω–æ–º —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ. –ß–µ–≥–æ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏: –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –∏—Ö –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Å –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ –≤ –≤–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö speakers rooms, —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã –∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ, –∞ —Å–µ—Å—Å–∏—è –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤ - –¥–æ–ª—å—à–µ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —É –≤–∞—Å –±—ã–ª–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, –±—Ä–æ–Ω–∏—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ç-–∞-—Ç–µ—Ç –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–æ —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –≤ advise lounge; name: User Group Days - Community Event
description: This event is Eastern Daylight Time. Please adjust to your timezone. To attend the event and view replays, you must register here: https://bit.ly/2yUjVeS This time, users take the stage! Experience a 2-Day Event Featuring 96 Hours of Content from IBM Customers and Experts. User Groups include: AI, Automation, Cloud Integration, Cloud Pak for Data, Cognos Common, DataOps, Data Science, Db2, IBM Security, Informix Maximo, NETCOOL, Netezza, Open Source, Power Systems Public Cloud, Storage, Websphere, Z Systems. We are uniting over a dozen IBM User Groups for a 2-day virtual conference with 6 tracks each day featuring lessons, demos, keynotes, feedback sessions, expert advice, and more. Choose from a comprehensive selection of sessions presented by IBM professionals, partners, customers, and users from around the world who are excited to share their knowledge and expertise with you. Learn more about the technologies you use every day, start a conversation, ask questions, or find new User Groups to connect with. No matter your technology, tool, or proficiency, you will find something here to grow your skillset. Join us on May 19 & 20 for the free, live event! Hashtag:#IBMUserGroupDay Register for this event here: https://bit.ly/2yUjVeS We look forward to hearing from you. –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Data, Cloud and AI in Moscow To see all meetups in this group: https://www.meetup.com/pro/ibm-community/ This is an IBM sponsored Meetup group geared towards developers, data scientists, data engineers, and ALL Big Data, Cloud and AI enthusiasts. Our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data portfolio and to interact and share knowledge with experts at IBM and in our extended community. Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology. It is followed by ~3 hours to collaborate with fellow developers and apply your Big Data skills. We provide a cloud environment that you can run through the browser of your laptop at NO cost to you. Our meetups are FREE. Meetup topics include: - Hadoop-based analytics - Stream Computing - Text Analytics - Visualization and Discovery tools for Big Data - Big Data App Development - Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible - Anything and everything about Big Data Join us today for a hands on software development experience. All presentations are available on Slideshare ! To download the Quick Start edition of BigInsights: http://ibm.co/QuickStart To download the Quick Start edition for Streams: http://ibm.co/streamsQS

name: Webinar "Habitat: where Artificial Intelligent agents live"
description: This month we going live again with webinar: Habitat: where Artificial Intelligent agents live by Oleksandr Maksymets, Research Engineer in Facebook AI Research Imagine walking up to a home robot and asking "Hey robot ‚Äî can you go check if my laptop is on my desk? And if so, bring it to me." AI Habitat enables training of such embodied AI agents (virtual robots and egocentric assistants) in a highly photorealistic & efficient 3D simulator, before transferring the learned skills to reality. We will talk about state of the art in training intelligent agents‚Äô domain using machine learning and how to scale a model to 30 years of house walking experience. Oleksandr Maksymets is a research engineer at Facebook AI Research (FAIR) working on embodied agent navigation using deep learning. Co-author and maintainer of Open Source Habitat AI Framework from FAIR that brings community benchmarks to the field and supports simulation to reality transferability. Oleksandr was one of organizers of Embodied AI challenges and workshops for CVPR 2019/2020. Oleksandr joined Facebook in October 2015 and worked on query understanding and document understanding at Facebook. He led a multilingual joint phrase and Facebook entities embeddings project that serves as a back-bone for multiple applications as entity linking and key phrase extractions.He is co-inventor on patent "Searching Online Social Networks Using Entity-based Embeddings". He also implemented the mechanism of language models internationalization of Facebook Search. From 2013 to 2015, Oleksandr was an assistant professor in the Cybernetics Department at Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv. In 2014 Oleksandr received his PhD in computer science from Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, Ukraine. Publications: Habitat: A platform for embodied ai research M Savva, A Kadian, O Maksymets, Y Zhao, E Wijmans, B Jain, J Straub, ... Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision, 9339-9347 Embodied question-answering in photorealistic environments with point cloud perception E Wijmans, S Datta, O Maksymets, A Das, G Gkioxari, S Lee, I Essa, ... Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Join our event on Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/devCKyiv Follow us on social platforms: Telegram: t.me/DeveloperCircle Telegram Jobs: t.me/DeveloperCircleJobs Instagram: www.instagram.com/devckyiv YouTube: www.youtube.com/c/DeveloperCircle GitHub: github.com/DeveloperCircleHub Slack: join.slack.com/...yp-169_rUFUjZyHJg_f9orQXg This event going as Pie & AI is a series of #deeplearning meetups independently hosted by community groups ‚Äî learn more www.deeplearning.ai/events

name: PMCon: Online Edition
description: Over the last 6 years we gathered a lot of experts and speakers in PMCon offline conferences, but it‚Äôs time to try something new and expand the horizons. We‚Äôre pleased to announce the PMCon: Online Edition! What‚Äôs different this year is that our event will go online and will be absolutely free for our participants! A two-day, online event with one stream of speeches awaits you. We‚Äôll talk about relevant topics not only for PM and BA, but also for those who seek to develop their leadership skills. The list of topics this time is broad: leadership, personal branding, intercultural communication and much more. Speakers from around the world will share their international experiences and best practice. During the speeches, you‚Äôll be able to ask questions and afterward you‚Äôll have the opportunity to go into a virtual room and chat with the speaker directly. Our speakers: ‚óè Fred Williams, Founder (Agile Communicator, Trainer), Williams Technical; ‚óè Manuel De Vits, Founder & Managing Director at Valyman Consulting. Global Evangelist, Customer Engagement Lead at G-Core Labs S.A. ; ‚óè Angel Medinilla, Founder, and Lead Consultant at Proyectiles and Improvement21; ‚óè Torsten Koerting, Game Changer, Execution Giant, Branding Expert, Clarity Coach ‚óè Birgit Koerting, Leadership Strategist@ KOERTING Life & Business GmbH Presentation Language: English This year we‚Äôre making our conference free, so everyone can participate and improve their skills. More details and registration: pmcon.dev.pro Looking forward to meeting you!

name: SoftServe webinar: "Metaprogramming in JavaScript: Approach to solving domain-specific problems"
description: üí•Here comes the Node.js webinar at SoftServe!üí• On June, 25 you will get acquainted with our Senior Software Engineer Vladyslav Dukhin and: üëâGet to know metaprogramming in JavaScript (Introspection, Reflection, Homoiconicity, Proxies, Symbols usage, metadata etc) üëâTake a deep look at how to use it to create domain-specific languages on top of JavaScript. üëâUnderstand how Metaprogramming helps divide software into solid abstractions to achieve better scalability and maintainability. Besides, we‚Äôll show you some techniques how to solve complex problems easier. Sounds intriguing, doesn‚Äôt it? No time to wait, register here: hubs.ly/H0r3lpL0 , save the date, and keep reading the Agenda below! Agenda: 18:30 ‚Äî 19.30 ‚Äî Vladyslav Dukhin: "Metaprogramming in JavaScript: Approach to solving domain-specific problems" 19.30 ‚Äî 20.00 ‚Äî Q&A session Event on Facebook: hubs.ly/H0r8Qbr0

name: Webinar: PR for Startups
description: It is not a secret ‚Äî in order to grow‚Äôn‚Äôglow your startup you need an effective promotion. And there are a few secret sauces that will give your company the lift it needs as effectively as press coverage. Here is where Public Relations steps in. üî• It is no coincidence that today‚Äôs hottest startups are all over the media. That‚Äôs the magic of PR chemistry at work. Indeed, all these brands have amazing products ‚Äî but behind every great brand story in the media, there is a big PR strategy behind. And with the right approach, you can turn your startup into press-worthy news. At the same time, Public Relations is evolving faster than an out-of-control science-fiction character and a big startup-story exposure doesn‚Äôt happen just by chance. üîπ Why do startups need PR? üîπ How to become press-worthy? üîπ How do you master a startup story for media? Join the event to find out practical tips & tricks on PR for startups. Speaker: üî∏Julia Petryk ‚Äî PR Lead at MacPaw & Author of Product PR online course. Projector School Startup Mentor; Mentor at Startup Wise Guys; Mentor at Seedstars. Speaker at: IT Arena 2017, Lviv; IT Arena 2019, Lviv; PIRATE Summit 2019, Cologne. üìç Join us live on Facebook . We will publish a video when the event starts! üóìAdd it to your calendar ‚Äî shorturl.at/kGIT8

name: Webinar "Business development competency for Project managers"
description: Strategic and Business Management is one of the three PMI‚Äôs Talent Triangle dimensions together with Technical Project management and Leadership. Business development is the creation of long-term value for an organization from customers, markets, and relationships. What could this mean in practice? Let‚Äôs discuss. Target audience ‚Äî Project Managers, PMO experts, HRBPs Anna Kompanets, PMO Competence Manager at SoftServe, 11 years of experience in project and change management across various companies. Active participant, trainer and volunteer at PMI Ukraine Chapter and ACMP Ukraine (Association of Change Management Professionals). She is passionate about organizational changes and their impact on people, actively promotes change management in her company and in the community of project managers. Registration ‚Äî pmlitswebinar.ticketforevent.com

name: Big Android Battle: languages in Java6 wasteland
Remote Control: Running Critical Infrastructure from Home: Is it Possible?
description: When it comes to security sensitive organizations, such as utilities, working from home is not always an option. In fact, many utilities have taken pains to lock down access points to their networks, sometimes disconnecting services from the internet completely. As most workplaces move to remote operations, utilities are now forced into an extremely difficult choice‚Äîdo they risk the health of their staff or the security of their systems? However, there are ways critical infrastructure providers can enable remote work for sensitive systems. Our CTO, and utility IT expert Mark Damm walks through issues and strategies, including: ‚Ä¢ Criteria for controlling remote systems ‚Ä¢ Securing and managing user access ‚Ä¢ Role of robotics and autonomous control –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://fuseforward.zoom.us/webinar/register/1915917319244/WN_W4idQQEITA62JLOufLxdjQ –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Cloud Computing, AI, Big Data, & Machine Learning Anyone interested in Cloud Computing, Big Data, AI, Machine Learning and data science & learning from the very top resources in these fields. We will be running a series of virtual events to look at today's top topics on cloud computing, big data, ml, ai, data science, data analytics, data vis, and data integration. There's been a convergence of these techs and we hope to explore how they're all working together to modernize today's systems & workforce. We'll look at specific case studies on how companies are deploying cloud‚Äôs speed, power, and agility to help fulfill the promises of real-time analytics, systems modernization, intelligent supply chains, revamped operating models, cultural change; and transform their operations. Some areas of interest to cover include Green Cloud Computing; Edge Computing; Cloud Cryptography; Load Balancing; Cloud Analytics; Cloud Scalability; Service Model; Cloud Computing Platforms; Mobile Cloud Computing; Big Data; Cloud Deployment Model; Cloud Security; Data Integration; Data Visualization

‚≠ê–ñ–∏–≤–æ–π –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç. –ù–∏–∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–≤, —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∂–∏–≤–∞—è –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏—è –∏ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–µ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–µ–π; ‚≠ê–î–µ–Ω–∏—Å –∏ –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂—É—Ç –æ —Å–µ–±–µ –∏ –æ —Ç–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –æ–Ω–∏ –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏—Å—å —Ç–∞–º, –≥–¥–µ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç; ‚≠ê–û–±—Å—É–¥–∏–º, –∫–∞–∫ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∏—Å—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã –≤ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å —Ç–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∏ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥ –≤–æ—Ç —É–∂–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–∞ –Ω–µ –≤–∏–¥–µ–ª–∏—Å—å –¥—Ä—É–≥ —Å –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º; ‚≠ê–ß—Ç–æ –¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ: —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –∏–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏—è, –æ–±—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –≤ –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–∏—Ö —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è—Ö –∏–ª–∏ —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –µ—â—ë? name: –í–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∫—Ä—É–≥–ª—ã–π —Å—Ç–æ–ª —Å –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∞–º–∏ –∏–∑ –õ–æ–Ω–¥–æ–Ω–∞ –∏ –∏–∑ –ú—é–Ω—Ö–µ–Ω–∞
description: –í—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ. Join a virtual round table with Software Developers from London and Munich. Here you can: * listen or give 5 minutes long lighting talks about any related topics, * participate in a discussion about "big" topics chosen by the participants, * meet and learn people coming to the table from virtually everywhere, * participate in a lottery to win a JetBrain personal license. The original event description follows. See you at the table Dimitry ---------------- We will start from 20:00 (Moscow time) with a bit of chit-chat, at 20:15 we will have our usual introduction, at 20:20 we will be doing lightning talks (5 mins max, please), then we will proceed to select "big" topics for discussion, and divide ourselves into separate rooms to discuss those topics. Anyone remaining at 22:00 can convene back into the main room to say goodbyes. Some additional rules for this online event: - In general, stay unmuted, unless you have a noisy environment (Alt+A/Cmd+Shift+A for quick muting/un-muting). We have found that it helps creating a good atmosphere - Try to use a headset or headphones with a good directional microphone. As a general rule, laptops microphone/speaker combo tend to be horrible. - We will have one person of the organisation on each room to help moderate. Use the chat to indicate that you want to speak. The moderator will take care of giving you the turn to speak. - Don't be afraid of using the chat for small comments while someone else is talking, but keep it in topic. - Use the Zoom "Raise Hand" functionality We will be raffling 2 Jetbrain Personal License. We will be using Zoom for the event. You can use it on the web browser, after telling it like three times you don't want to use the desktop version, in case you don't want to use the desktop version. Any question regarding the event, please drop us a message so we can provide answers. Code of Conduct: https://communitycodeofconduct.com/ –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://codurance.zoom.us/j/98427602589?pwd=U0x4RDc2NmFpWll4c3RIdHRmc1ljZz09 –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: –ì–∏–ª—å–¥–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –ú—ã - —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ü–û, –∂–µ–ª–∞—é—â–∏—Ö –æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è, –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–∞—Ç—å –º–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ, —É—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –¥—Ä—É–≥ —É –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞, –æ–±–º–µ–Ω–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º –∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ. –ú—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Ç–∞–∫–∏–º–∏ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –∫–∞–∫ Coding Dojo, Open Space, Lean Coffee. –í –Ω–∞—à–∏—Ö –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∞—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Å—Å–∏–π —Å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞–º–∏ –∏–∑ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω. name: –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π Docker meetup —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ —Å SPb Docker Users Group
Scaling up Spacecraft Operations with AI
description: This is an online event - register here: https://bit.ly/37gUyB8 Earth counts about 2000 human-made objects in orbit and far more if you count the debris. Nowadays, contracts are signed to send the same amount of satellites in large scale projects called constellations. With collaborative and adversarial objects crossing each other at 7km per second, one has to make sure they are all in good shape of operations. How do you check on 2000 spacecrafts when today's missions require 2 to 10 people per satellite? Ground teams have to scale up and AI might be their best teammate. On June 18th at 12:00 MSK, H2O.ai will be sharing the virtual stage with Dr Redouane Boumghar, core contributor at the Libre Space Foundation, for an online meetup where he will give his view and expertise on how AI is being used in spacecraft operations. As part of his talk, he will present the Polaris project, an international team of enthusiasts and space professionals who maintain open source machine learning pipelines to analyze spacecraft telemetry, extract their different behaviors, link them, and learn from the context in order to build transportable knowledge and reasoning. Dr. Redouane Boumghar, aka Red, worked on many different Artificial Intelligence projects in robotics and perception in the satellite imagery industry. He is a former research fellow in the team for AI in Space Operations at the European Space Agency and currently leads ideation processes for the data intelligence portfolio for the European Central Bank. Red believes in open inter-planetary collaboration where space is claimed the libre way. That's why, as a core contributor of the Libre Space Foundation, he shares and maintains a fully open source machine learning project for future autonomous space operations. –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Moscow Artificial Intelligence & Deep Learning We‚Äôre excited to bring you the latest happenings in AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Science and Big Data. Who are we? We‚Äôre H2O.ai ( https://www.h2o.ai/ ), creators of the world‚Äôs leading open-source machine learning platform, used by hundreds of thousands of data scientists and 18,000 organizations around the world. Our goal is to congregate with data enthusiasts and discuss trending topics in the world of AI. We also regularly invite esteemed industry influencers and thought leaders who talk shop on all things data science. Sound like a good time? Interested in H2O or our automatic machine learning platform, H2O Driverless AI? Learn more here: https://www.h2o.ai/download/ Already a rainmaker (H2O power user) or have questions? Please visit our StackOverflow page. ( http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/h2o ) If you‚Äôd like to speak at future meetups, co-promote your meetup or inquire about sponsorship opportunities, please reach out to ian@h2o.ai. Read about our code of conduct here: https://www.h2o.ai/code-of-conduct/ Thank you for advancing the future of data science, Ian Follow us on Twitter: @h2oai

description: –ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, –º—ã IKnow English School! –ü—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—à–∞–µ–º –≤–∞—Å –Ω–∞ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω —É—Ä–æ–∫ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –º—ã —Ä–∞–∑–±–µ—Ä–µ–º incident reports –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏—Ö —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å, –∫—Ç–æ –∏—Ö –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å, –∫—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∑–∞ –∏—Ö –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –∏ —Ç.–¥. –ß—Ç–æ –º—ã —Ä–∞–∑–±–µ—Ä–µ–º –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–∫–µ: ‚úîÔ∏èTypes of reports ‚úîÔ∏èWhat is an incident report (IR)? ‚úîÔ∏èPeople and consequences ‚úîÔ∏èReasons to write an IR ‚úîÔ∏èBenefits of an IR ‚úîÔ∏èTips to consider before writing an IR ‚úîÔ∏èUseful language ‚úîÔ∏èAn IR structure ‚úîÔ∏èHow to start an IR email? ‚úîÔ∏èHow to end an IR email? –î–µ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ —É—Ä–æ–∫–∞: –î–∞—Ç–∞: 17.06 –í—Ä–µ–º—è: 19:00 –î–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å: 90 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –°—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å: –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è: –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω, Zoom –ú—ã –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ —Ö–æ—Ç–∏–º –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–∫, –º—ã —Ö–æ—Ç–∏–º —É–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –≤—ã –∑–∞–∫—Ä–µ–ø–∏–ª–∏ –≤–∞—à–∏ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —É—Ä–æ–∫–∞ –≤–∞—Å –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∂–¥–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–µ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–µ–ø–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è. –î–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–µ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç—å –∏–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∏ –∑–∞–∫—Ä–µ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–∏ (—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã) –∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ (–æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã). ‚úîÔ∏è –°—Å—ã–ª–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏: forms.gle/Cf9vSbfEjhN51WXS6 –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –æ –Ω–∞—Å: Instagram: www.instagram.com/iknow_english_school Facebook: www.facebook.com/iknowenglishschool Telegram: t.me/iknow_english_school –¢–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω –º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä–∞: 067 774 4284

name: Webinar "Architecture Conversation"
description: Welcome to a wide-ranging talk about cloud architecture solutions, latest technologies, and operational maturity. Our celebrity speaker will share his overwhelming experience with different cloud platforms. Discover how the latest technology may help your customers improve their business. Learn the professional approach to the optimization of enterprise-grade data-driven applications. To do a professional job, you need to discover all parts of the existing customer‚Äôs environment. What is even more important, you need to connect all these pieces to the current tactical focus because proposed architecture changes may impact each connected part. So, how can you build trust with your customer to get all the information you need? Every customer is different, and every industry is different ‚Äî but they share many common concerns and goals. The DB Best team has an 18-year history and track record of delivering ground-breaking projects for our valued customers. In doing so, we established a proven process, which ensures the supreme quality of delivery and allows for exceeding customer‚Äôs expectations. And now, we are ready to share this approach with you. Visit the webinar to learn how you can zoom in on the existing customer‚Äôs technology and problem at hand through the architecture conversation. Who should attend? Chief technology officers Chief information officers Vice presidents of information technology Information technology directors Cloud solution architects Software architects Database developers and administrators Technical project managers Speaker Peter Skj√∏tt Larsen Senior Director & Principal Architect procloud.events/...rchitecture-conversation

name: Webinar "In the road. Growth and changes in teams‚Äô lifetime"
Pitch, please!
description: ‚òéÔ∏è Calling B2B invested startups, hello? How you pitch your startup plays a significant role in attracting co-partners, investors, and a skilled team. What are the secrets behind a captivating pitch that will make you stand out among others? What secret sauces would you need for an online-pitch? Come join us live to learn tips and tricks on online pitching lifehacks and get feedback on your own pitch from the world‚Äôs largest software maker ‚Äî Microsoft, which has recently launched a very special program ‚Äî Microsoft for Startups ( startups.microsoft.com/en-us/benefits ) ‚Äî an initiative to help startups create, develop, and market enterprise-level software. The program is focused on boosting the startup ecosystem across the world and helping amazing ideas come to reality. üí• Together with our mentors, Mihkel Rembel (Microsoft) and Elise Sass (LIFT99), we will talk about the following things: ‚ö°Ô∏è Practical tips & tricks to keep in mind while preparing your online-pitch; ‚ö°Ô∏è What you should and should not do while pitching; ‚ö°Ô∏è The best way to present your product, service, and company through value and communication; üçí A cherry on top: get feedback on your own pitch if you would like to get some practice with our professional trainers. Or listen to others‚Äô pitches and learn tips from that! ‚òÑÔ∏è More about our mentors: Mihkel Rembel ‚Äî Microsoft Startup Program Manager. Mihkel‚Äôs mission is to help startups grow in every stage of their lifecycle by building a strong community in CEE countries and providing B2B startups a variety of perks as networking resources, tutorials, and business design session, Azure credits, sales support, and many more. Come check what Mihkel got for you! üî• Elise Sass ‚Äî a co-founder and COO of LIFT99co, pitch trainer, and a startup advisor. She is a founding member of Estonia‚Äôs first startup accelerator Startup Wise Guys, and ran Garage48 hackathons. She has also led Microsoft‚Äôs Central Eastern European team to drive the cooperation between corporate and startup world. According to Elise, the secret of any pitch is: "Be yourself! It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre pitching to co-founders or investors, you need to present the way you feel comfortable. It still means that you need lots of practice and should be able to deliver a 1 minute or a 5-minute pitch the moment you wake up. üöÄ üóì August 25th, Tuesday üïô 12:00 (GMT+3) üë®‚Äçüíªüë©‚Äçüíª For whom it might be relevant: B2B invested startups ‚úÖ NB! This event is APPLY ONLY! Please, fill in this registration form by 14:00 (GMT+3), August 21st: lift99.typeform.com/to/gZjJsSyT You will receive a link for the event to your email after finishing the registration form. See you!

name: Webinar "Balancing client traffic in baremetal kubernetes"
description: Hello everybody! Kubernetes is widely adopted infrastructure for applications and services. There is a lot of information available on cloud deployments, but bare metal (on premise) deployment adds some major challenges. One of them is organizing external traffic flow into the Kubernetes cluster. This presentation might be useful for people running or intending to run kubernetes on premises. It will give a general overview of widely used/known technologies for client traffic balancing to applications and provide hints for efficient traffic ingestion into the Kubernetes cluster. Speaker: Roman Davydchenko ‚Äî Vimmi System Architect, 12 years in industry. Rather follow the link and register: docs.google.com/...b9cA/viewform?usp=sf_link

name: What is Venture Debt, and is it Right for your Company? (Online Event)
description:
As startups have proliferated this last decade, so have funding options for entrepreneurs looking to scale and grow their businesses. One alternative financing model gaining popularity is venture debt. On this live Q&A event, experts on the topic will share the basics of venture debt and capital-based financing, outline the types of businesses best suited for this type of financing, and answer any questions that you have. Our special guest for this event is Mike Luebbers, Chief Credit Officer of Lighter Capital (one of the fastest-growing alternative financing businesses in North America). Topics Include: What types of companies are best suited for revenue-based financing? What are the requirements? Things entrepreneurs should understand going in >>> THIS IS AN ONLINE EVENT. TO RSVP, VISIT https://fi.co/event/what-is-venture-debt-and-is-it-right-for-your-company-online-event-silicon-valley-virtual . To join after the event begins, go to http://onlinestartupevents.com . ABOUT THE SPEAKER: Mike Luebbers, Chief Credit Officer, Lighter Capital Prior to joining Lighter Capital, Mike worked in the commercial banking industry financing small businesses and technology start-ups. Mike began his career in the Silicon Valley with Comerica Bank, and most recently was the Chief Credit Officer at Bridge Bank. Mike received a BA from the University of Washington and an MBA from the University of California at Berkeley. About Lighter Capital Lighter Capital offers a mix of entrepreneur-friendly product offerings‚Äîincluding revenue-based financing (RBF), term loans with pre-approval for a forward commitment, and lines of credit‚Äîto empower early-stage tech startups with the flexibility they need to fund the business at different stages of growth. Learn more at www.lightercapital.com. Learn more about the Founder Institute pre-seed startup accelerator at http://fi.co/ and see other online startup events at http://onlinestartupevents.com . –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://zoom.us/j/99155053577?pwd=dFNaYnJlek43dGFLR05GaDR2SFhDdz09 –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Moscow Startup Founder 101 Startup Founder 101 brings together aspiring and experienced tech entrepreneurs to discuss, meet, and collaborate to build great new startups, and to push the local startup ecosystem forward.

This group hosts numerous free events throughout the year where you can learn the best practices of starting a company from people who have been there and done that. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to meet local founders and investors, exchange ideas with experts, get feedback on your idea, participate in startup workshops, and more.

Typical startup event topics include:
‚Ä¢ Coming up with a strong startup idea
‚Ä¢ Startup legal basics
‚Ä¢ How to pitch your startup
‚Ä¢ Starting a company without quitting your day job
‚Ä¢ How to raise funding for your startup
‚Ä¢ And much more!

Join the group to be invited to our next event!

A strong incubator will accelerate your growth, moving you to the next level ‚Äî critical for a new business with limited funds, time, and personnel. Strong mentors and a better understanding of how to build a business can help you avoid the classic mistakes that new entrepreneurs often encounter. name: –í–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä: product manager vs project manager ‚Äî who rules?
Startup Pitch Contests
description: The Global Inclusion Online Forum Startup Pitch Contest is one of the first startup pitches that offers a platform to early-stage startups that are dealing with inclusion issues. In addition to what our innovation partners are pledging to donate, CFC Big Ideas commits to putting $6 from every paid ticket to the Forum into the prize fund. –°ontests: Inclusion Solutions For startups that have developed unique products and services that considers the full range of human diversity ‚Äî ability, language, culture, gender, age and other forms of human difference Financial Services For startups that offer financial services or investment to entrepreneurs from underrepresented groups or minorities. The objective of such startups should follow such a rule: to include different categories of people into the economic and financial system by engaging them into new financial tools and facilities HR Solutions For startups that offer products, services or tools that have a positive impact on inclusive hiring, staffing, talent acquisition, applying for vacancies or ensuring an unbiased workplace experience Competition schedule: Application and Recruitment Period: till 22 August 2020 Finalists Selection: 23‚Äì25 August 2020 Pitch Preparations‚Äô Testing sessions: 26‚Äì31 August 2020 Pitch Presentations: 4 September 2020 (in a separate stream of the Online Forum) Winners Announcement: 4 September 2020 To learn more about the event and how to apply, please visit the main website of the Global Inclusion Online Forum !

name: Webinar | How to grow as a PRO BA: effective tips and life hacks
description: It‚Äôs really hard to stay PRO if you don‚Äôt grow up every day. This webinar will cover the questions ‚Äî what skills, knowledge, actions, and decisions can increase your authority and value for the client, company, and market. You‚Äôll hear the ideas and suggestions ‚Äî what to start doing today to become a more mature BA tomorrow. During the webinar, we‚Äôll talk about: ‚Äî What soft skills are the most desired for BA practitioners and how to develop them? ‚Äî What cases force you to learn something new? ‚Äî What to do to make both client and team happy while working with you? About speaker: Irene is BA-practitioner at Softserve with five years of experience in different domains ‚Äî remote monitoring and management, solar energy, real estate, and others. Irene was covering both Business Analyst and Product Owner positions. She also has experience as a mentor, trainer, and public speaker. The webinar would be interesting for all BAs, product owners, and those who do all business analysis related work regardless of the title. It will be held in ENGLISH. Our event is free, but registration is required. Register here: bit.ly/37UTUJJ Follow our updates and let the BA force be with you! Event link at Facebook: bit.ly/2Z1hsst

name: Webinar: The Future of Work is the Education of Today
description: –ó–∞–ø—Ä–æ—à—É—î–º–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ –≤—ñ–¥–≤—ñ–¥–∞—Ç–∏ –≤–µ–±—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ–º—É ‚ÄûThe Future of Work is the Education of Today". –ù–∞—à—ñ –∫–æ–ª–µ–≥–∏ –∑—ñ –®–≤–µ—Ü—ñ—ó —Ä–æ–±–ª—è—Ç—å –∫—Ä—É—Ç–µ–∑–Ω–∏–π —ñ–≤–µ–Ω—Ç –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ, —â–æ —Ç–∞–∫–µ –æ—Å–≤—ñ—Ç–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏ —É –Ω–∞–π–±–ª–∏–∂—á–æ–º—É –º–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—å–æ–º—É. –í–µ–±—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –∑–∞ –ø–æ–ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–Ω—å–æ—ó —Ä–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó ‚Äî bit.ly/3f4bRrC –£ –¥–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞–¥—ñ—à–ª–µ–º–æ —Ç–æ–±—ñ –ø–æ—Å–∏–ª–∞–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞ Zoom –£–≤–∞–≥–∞! –ú–æ–≤–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—è –≤–µ–±—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä—É ‚Äî –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞. The future of work is the education of today. As revealed in his TedX talk ‚Äî The Future of Work ‚Äî Tano will use this event to dive deep into the considerations we must all take into account when approaching the occupational and professional ecosystem of the future. Recent global incidents have sped up digital transformation, along with the way we connect and communicate in a rapidly changing world. Therefore, it is more important than ever to think about how we are educating ourselves, being it will correlate with the way we work in the future. Tano will explain his vision from startups to corporations, and address the subjects of human nature that are irreplaceable by machines. About the speaker Tano Lopez is a Spanish entrepreneur who focuses on impact startups in diverse areas like EdTech, mobility, fintech and blockchain. With a passion for entrepreneurship, he was one of the first to build an eCommerce in Spain, in 2003. Tano is a double graduate in journalism/communication and marketing/sales. He developed the majority of his career while living in Spain and the USA. He has participated in diverse programs like Google‚Äôs growth engine for Europe, Eoi European Union accelerator, Berkeley University international summer course and NYU StartEd accelerator. Tano currently combines running his startup with being an advisor for Santander Bank, focusing on international entrepreneurship and education. His main area of study is the future of education and work, which includes digital transformation and new business models as revealed in his TEDx talk: ‚ÄûThe Future of Work." This online event is FREE and will be held in ENGLISH. More info ‚Äî www.facebook.com/events/548075972524201

name: Webinar "How to create a brand image for startups and small businesses"
description: The first main goal of a business owner is to launch an idea, test it, and get feedback as soon as possible. But what is next? When you already have a product, technology, or service that is ready to be sold to millions. How to create a brand that will bring more value and be understandable to the user? What kind of design is appropriate for your company? Let‚Äôs talk about: üîπ Difference between Brand and Branding. Why we mess up it? üîπ Why should a design team be involved in Positioning and Strategy steps? üîπ Why does a brand need to have a Social Mission. What to do, if it doesn‚Äôt sound from your soul. Ordinary or Extraordinary. How not to be like your competitors but to play in your industry‚Äôs rules? üîπ Big changes, big risks. Why are some companies afraid to change color, when others change even naming. üîπ How to be not too trendy and change design each year? üîπ What the design system consists of? What should you know before hiring a design team? üîπ Who cares about business cards? Where does the brand actually live? An important element that you will need. üîπ You can‚Äôt use the same template all the time. How to maintain and develop brand visuals? üé§ Speaker: üî∏ Lera Shaposhnikova ‚Äî creative director, founder, and brand designer of Orchidea Agency. Orchidea is a branding design agency working with sustainable brands that care about people & the planet. That is consulting, create, and support visually attractive brands and work with modern social culture. Lera has experience with more than 80 brands and she has been in the design industry for over 7 years. She‚Äôs worked with Black Coffee, Norba, Art-zavod Platforma, Letsbar, Giftmall, Public Kitchen, Indposhiv Bespoke House, Frank Wines, Litkovskaya, Matter Labs and so on. üìç Join us live on Facebook . name: Webinar "Notification service. Hangfire with SQLite"
description: Join the online session and learn more about the Task Scheduler in the .NET Ecosystem and how to handle background tasks inside any .NET Core Applications using Hangfire. Speaker: Dima Ostapenko ‚Äî Tech Lead in SoftServe, with Microsoft, FP and Data Science background. During the webinar you will get answers for these questions: What is Hangfire? How to build complex stateful, fault-tolerant, background processing within a seconds? What benefits Hangfire from running separate daemons, services, or Cron jobs? Any cloud options for the task scheduler? What is fire and forget principle, states, continuations, delayed/recurring run, retries. what kind of licenses we can use for enterprise and beyond? At the end, we will walk through real-world use cases with hangfire on SQLite. Register now: hubs.ly/H0rHPr00

name: Webinar "The only real risk, and how to disarm big decisions"
description: We haven‚Äôt stopped for a minute and are continuing to plan a series of online meetings. üî• On May 28th, at 19:00 Kyiv time (UTC+2), we invite you to join the next Beetroot webinar. The topic of our next meeting is ‚Äî "The only real risk, and how to disarm big decisions" . Everyone will face big and defining decisions in life. Whether they are personal or connected to your job, you can approach these decisions in helpful ways, making them easier to work through. Decisions also often come with risks, but with the right approach, these risks can be less scary and actually quite useful. Maybe you‚Äôll dare to make a big decision that you normally wouldn‚Äôt consider? Doing so could lead to outcomes you‚Äôve never imagined! ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Our speaker will be Gustav Henman ‚Äî co-founder of Beetroot & Beetroot Academy. Gustav is a technical entrepreneur with more than 15 years of experience, and founder of several tech startups and emerging organizations. Gustav has a MSc Biomedical engineering degree from Chalmers University of Technology and great experience working with business development and companies from more than 20 countries worldwide. As one of the founders of Beetroot and Beetroot Academy, Gustav will also share stories and experiences connected to his years spent developing these companies. The webinar is FREE. To join, simply register here: forms.gle/dPWVb2FWeKjXkBPR7 Once you register, you will receive a confirmation email. We‚Äôll use Google Hangouts for the event. Feel free to ask any questions: tatyana.nityagina@beetroot.se

name: Technologication Online Conference
description: The crisis has once again shown us the unpredictability of the world we live in. In business, such situations are called VUCA ‚Äî volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous. The only way to curb chaos and always be one step ahead is to innovate. Parimatch Tech presents Technologication, an international online conference on the role of technology in business development. Experts from AWS, Microsoft, Booking . com, Genesis Investment, and Parimatch Tech will reveal the secrets of innovation for the most successful companies, discuss the importance of artificial intelligence in the future world, and offer actionable advice on the best practices of digital transformation. Speakers ‚ñ™Ô∏è Xiaopeng Li, Microsoft ‚ñ™Ô∏è Lucas Bernardi, Booking . com ‚ñ™Ô∏è Attila Lengyel, AWS ‚ñ™Ô∏è Elena Mazhuha, Genesis Investments ‚ñ™Ô∏è Grigory Bakunov, Parimatch Tech Why does every business need to be high-tech? How will innovation drive the bottom line in the future? How does one build a team that is not afraid to break stereotypes and create something new? Find out the answers to these and many more questions on July 15 at Technologication. Facebook event Register now

name: Webinar "API testing within Salesforce. Managing objects with Postman"
description: We are excited to invite you to our webinar "API testing within Salesforce. Managing objects with Postman" We will discuss the basic principles of working with Salesforce Platform, in particular, API testing with Postman, Workbench, Query Editor, etc. Our speaker will tell you about the main functions of these tools. You will learn how to connect them with Salesforce sandbox, and how to create, update and delete data with their help. üìù Agenda: 1. What is REST? 2. Why Postman? 3. Basic API requests. 4. name: Big Data & Data Science Community Meetup #12
Webinar "Special Issues for Academic Startups"
description: Ukraine has a deep and substantial academic community. No doubt, startups based on that strength can compete and succeed globally ‚Äî if they can recruit and develop the necessary business talent. This can be a particular challenge for academics, not just in Ukraine but around the world. How can research become entrepreneurship; how can technology be commercialized through a startup? Join: ‚óè Charles Whitehead, e≈ç co-founder; ‚óè –†–æ–º–∞–Ω –¢–æ–º–∞—à–µ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π, CEO & Cofounder, ICardy, and e≈ç alumnus; ‚óè Eduard Simson, e≈ç Kharkiv Coordinator. Learn about transforming academic research into a new business. ICardy created a revolutionary product that detects atrial fibrillation (AFib) in real time, even when the person suffering an AFib attack is unaware of it. Detecting AFib can lower the risk of heart disease and improve the quality and duration of a patient‚Äôs life. iCardy was selected, in a global competition, to take part in the GIST Business Incubation program in Phoenix, Arizona, for 4 weeks at the Center for Entrepreneurial Innovation. Register here: bit.ly/2xYnqRx The event will be live streamed on the e≈ç Business Incubators Facebook page.

name: Webinar "How to benefit on COVID trends with better customer analytics?"
description: How to benefit on COVID trends with better customer analytics? Customer analytics a concept of applying principles of Machine Learning in order to predict customer choices and decisions. With the COVID good understanding of customer mindset became essential to survive and benefit. During this webinar, we will discuss a few insightful and contra-intuitive trends of quarantined customers, customer analytics use cases and methods. The webinar is free, registration at the link: forms.gle/NM49qNiMAE14s1Mr5

name: WWDC 2020: Decoding the Keynote | Meetup & Discussion
description: WWDC is coming up, and in lieu of a physical event, the Setapp team is bringing together industry experts and the developer community to connect via an online meetup. Come to discuss how developers and users will be affected by the new macOS features and what these trends mean for the future. To participate, fill in this short registration form: stpp.co/wwdc2020-registration Agenda: ‚Äî Panel discussion: hear industry experts and ask questions. ‚Äî Breakout rooms discussion: meet your peers, share your thoughts, and network in small groups. Meet the speakers: 1. Max Seelemann, Co-Founder and Lead Developer at Ulysses (an award-winning writing app for Mac and iOS) 2. Christian Owens, Co-Founder and CEO at Paddle (leading the go-to-market and commercial efforts, one of the fastest-growing software companies in the UK) 3. Oleksandr Kosovan, CEO and Founder at MacPaw (one of the biggest software developers on the Mac market and the company behind Setapp, CleanMyMac, Gemini Photos, and more). More speakers to be announced soon. Meet the moderator: Charlotte Henry, Author and Associate Editor of The Mac Observer, covering how Apple is not just a revolutionary tech firm, but a revolutionary media firm. Event on Facebook: www.facebook.com/events/249850532989465 Join on Eventbrite: wwdc2020-meetup.eventbrite.com

name: PiterPy Meetup
description: –ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥—Å–∫–∏–µ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø—ã –ø—Ä–æ Python –∏ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–µ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø—ã –ø—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ –∂–∏–≤–æ–π —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Ç. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –º—ã –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –º–µ—Å—è—Ü —Å–æ–±–∏—Ä–∞–µ–º—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è, –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∏ —É–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ. –ë—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–≤–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞, –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏—Ö ‚Äî –ª–∞–π—Ç–Ω–∏–Ω–≥–æ–≤ –∏ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ-–±—Ä–µ–π–∫–∏. –í—Ö–æ–¥ —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π. –î–µ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è: https://piterpy.timepad.ru/ Python meetups in Saint Petersburg Good meetups are all about live human communication. That's why we gather monthly to chat, meet new people and learn new things. We have two main talks, a couple of lightning ones and coffeebreaks. Admission is free. Events details and registration: https://piterpy.timepad.ru/ –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: PiterPy Meetup PiterPy Meetup is a St. Petersburg, Russia based meetup with the focus on Python and the world of IT. We are trying to keep it informal, interesting and wholesome: talks, panel discussions, meetings. It makes no difference if you are a beginner or a long-standing programming veteran. Come learn new things and socialize ‚Äî it's free-to-enter! Please note: we support Berlin Code of Conduct (this applies both to online and offline). If you want to give a talk, message us :) If you have a question or want to offer a sponsorship / venue for the meetup, reach us at meetup@piterpy.ru.

name: PolkaDeFi Online - The Polkadot Decentralized Finance Community Conference
description: As Polkadot is in the middle of its mainnet launch process, join us for this free, one day, 3 hour conference focused on the Polkadot DeFi ecosystem! The conference will be hosted by Acala Network, and will feature speakers from Chainlink, Centrifuge, Parity Technologies, ChainX, Interlay, Laminar, and Plasm Network. Agenda and speakers: http://polkadefi.acala.network/ ===Other Resources=== Polkadot Launch Roadmap: https://polkadot.network/launch-roadmap/ Polkadot vision video feat. Dr. Gavin Wood, Polkadot founder and cofounder/CTO of Ethereum: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcOKXAOh4Xw Join the Polkadot Telegram: https://t.me/PolkadotOfficial Join the 200+ Polkadot Ambassadors worldwide, contributing in nontechnical and technical ways to the growth of Polkadot, Kusama, and Substrate: https://polkadot.network/polkadot-ambassador-program/ Are you a developer? Check out the brand new Substrate website and tutorials. Substrate is the framework for building custom, application-specific blockchains for Polkadot and Kusama: http://substrate.io Stay up-to-date with our ecosystem newsletters: https://info.polkadot.network/subscribe See you at PolkaDeFi, and if you have any questions in the meantime, reach out to us at [masked] or in the Polkadot Telegram channel. –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/polkadefi-conference/1?utm_source=meetup&utm_medium=meetup –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: Polkadot - Moscow Welcome to Polkadot, Moscow. This is the place for learning and hacking on Polkadot, a multichain platform that addresses blockchain governance, interoperability, and scalability issues. We will follow Polkadot's development and learn about developing parachains, tools, and DApps for the network.

name: Webinar "Intellectual property: Don‚Äôt mess with programmers!"
description: Intellectual property is often one of the most valuable assets and among the most important considerations that a startup encounters. Protecting intellectual property can be essential for obtaining venture capital funding or preventing competitors from unfairly competing with you. üìö Join a hot discussion with a case study and tips to ensure that the software developer does not take off with all the intellectual property. üî• Speaker: üî∏ Kati Pino ‚Äî Hedman Partners Law Firm associate. Kati advises entrepreneurs in various intellectual property matters, ranging from trademarks to social media assets, and ensures that the client‚Äôs intellectual property portfolio is well-established and managed. Kati also provides legal assistance for start-ups on all corporate and contractual issues including term sheets, investment agreements, convertible instruments, shareholder agreements, stock options, CAP tables, cross-border expansions, group restructurings, and flips to different jurisdictions. Hedman Partners ‚Äî a new generation law firm for technology-driven and digital businesses. üìç Join us live on Facebook . We will share a video when the event starts! üóì Add it to your calendar ‚Äî shorturl.at/gixE7

name: Q&A session with Roland Flemm for Scrum Masters and Project Managers

name: UiPath Test Suite: Mobile Automation: Virtual Meetup
description: Hello UiPath Community, Second most wanted virtual meetup is here: UiPath Test suite: Mobile Automation! Register for the session here: https://bit.ly/UiPathTestSuite . As soon as the sun shines and we struggle to wake up, the first thing we all need is our smartphone - even before we brush our teeth. People are consumed with their smartphones 24/7 and very rarely use a desktop computer for online activities. Businesses are making the best use of this opportunity by adopting a Mobile First strategy to rapidly expand their business. As such, applications are designed and launched for mobile devices before they are scaled up for larger display devices. This approach also requires a different testing strategy. Different network speeds, various input types, call interruptions, responsive design, and many other factors need to be considered in assessing the quality of mobile apps through test automation. Christian Mayer (Director, Product Management) https://www.linkedin.com/in/christian-mayer-2a26b112a/ will share how the UiPath Test Suite helps you to create resilient automated tests for your mobile apps and how to integrate your mobile testing strategy into your broader testing strategy. Please join the virtual meetup here: https://uipath.zoom.us/j/96825515813 Let‚Äôs virtually meet (again)! Luiza & the UiPath Community team –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏: https://uipath.zoom.us/j/96825515813 –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä: UiPath RPA Moscow This is a group for anyone interested in learning more about the RPA space and UiPath. –≠—Ç–∞ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤ –∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ–π –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ UiPath Check our T&C.

name: Webinar "Conformal learning"
description: Classical classification models allow to estimate the quality of predictions by associating their output with probability values. However, they do not allow to construct prediction models that are guaranteed to produce output with a specific level of accuracy. In this talk, we will discuss a framework of Conformal learning ‚Äî an approach that produces prediction with guarantees. We will talk about the main ideas and trends in Conformal learning, and the price that we have to pay for predictions with guarantees ‚Äî a reduction in precision. The webinar is free, registration at the link: Registration

name: SPbPy: Flask 0.11 release and Eve workshop / –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –ú–∞—Ç–≤–µ–µ–Ω–∫–æ
Webinar "Spring beans evolution"
description: Spring Framework is one of the most widespread and successful projects in Java ecosystem. Its core feature ‚Äî IoC container with DI support for managed objects called Spring beans. Moreover if you use other popular Spring projects (Spring Data, Spring Cloud, Spring MVC) then these projects give you Spring integration with underlying technologies and resource management based on IoC/Spring beans. However Spring framework provides backward compatibility for old Spring projects so it keeps all the legacy ways of beans declarations. So now it‚Äôs not so easy to understand which declaration approaches are obsolete and which ones should be used. In this talk we will dive for 20 years of Spring development and discover how Spring beans feature has evolved. We will also pay special attention for new features delivered in Spring Boot 2/Spring 5. We will also review best practices/common pitfalls of Spring beans usage. The speaker is Sergey Morenets, back-end developer with more than 20 years of programming experience, frequent speaker at Java conferences. This webinar will start on September 15th, at 19:30 EET. You will receive email with live broadcast link two days before the start. This is online webinar for Java developers of any level. Registration link: it-simulator.com/...g-beans-evolution?lang=en

name: Svitla Smart Talk: Building a rich web UI with C# using Blazor
description: Good news everyone! #SvitlaSmartTalk meetups began inviting speakers from all around the globe. Let there be no boundaries for learning! Today we gladly announce a webinar with Gill Cleeren, Microsoft MVP and RD from Belgium. His speech is devoted to building a rich web UI with C# using Blazor and will be useful for developers of all levels. With Blazor, Microsoft is introducing a framework that allows you to build rich experiences in-browser while being fully based in C# and HTML, using a syntax that‚Äôs very similar to ASP.NET development. Blazor is based on the foundations of WebAssembly, which is supported in every modern browser without the need for a plugin. Your Blazor app will work fine on mobile devices, even as a Progressive Web App (PWA). And where needed, you can still rely on already-created JavaScript components, since Blazor allows interop with JavaScript. Join us and learn about: ‚óè What is Blazor and what it can be used for? ‚óè How to leverage your C# knowledge to build rich interactive experiences for the web using Visual Studio. ‚óè How to create your first components. ‚óè How to interact with built-in JavaScript APIs. ‚óè How to deploy your app to Azure. Speaker Gill Cleeren ‚Äî CTO at Xpirit in Belgium. Recognized by Microsoft as MVP and RD. Started the local .NET user group which has been around since 2006. After running a local conference, founded Techorama in Belgium and the Netherlands, two Microsoft-oriented conferences reaching over 3000 attendees per year. As a trainer, teaches mostly .NET Core and Azure classes. Since 2012, has been active as Pluralsight author as well, creating over 30 courses so far. Event details: Date ‚Äî 19 August at 7PM (Kyiv timezone, GMT+3) Duration ‚Äî 2 hours (75 minutes ‚Äî lection, then ‚Äî Q&A session) Language: English All other details we will send after registration. Registration is free but compulsory. Facebook event ‚Äî www.facebook.com/events/822369551638616 Registration ‚Äî 2event.com/events/1859327

name: –ë–µ–ª–æ—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π –∫—É—Ä—Å IT-–ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∂ SaleSolution —Å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ–º –¥–ª—è BD, sales, CEO, BA –∏ RFX
Python TechTalks@Lohika: "Python "async" magic ‚Äî what‚Äôs under the hood?
description: What: Python TechTalks@Lohika: "Python ‚Äòasync‚Äô magic ‚Äî what‚Äôs under the hood?" by Sergii Grekov, Python guru at Lohika When: May, 12, 7:00 PM Where: On your couch :) We will send you a link for Teams meeting in a letter before the meeting. About TechTalks: As we know, the Python is traditionally a synchronous language, but it is constantly evolving. It is also being reconsidered in the direction of the possibility of using an asynchronous paradigm. During TechTalks our speaker would like to look at the history of this development, at least take a look under the hood of the implementation mechanisms considering the strengths and weaknesses of the asynchronous approach. The participation is free but we will really appreciate if you make any donation to "Your support" charity fund which gathers money for hospital equipment for covid-19 treatment. To make a donation: tvoya-opora.org/donate Please note that TechTalks materials require at least 3 years of commercial experience in SW engineering. –í–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ Search Guard –∏ Elastic Search - –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ - –ë–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–º –∏ REST —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è—Ö (–ü—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª TLS - name: Workshop "What is Design Thinking, and how can we use it in our projects?"
description: We are excited to invite you to our workshop "What is Design Thinking, and how can we use it in our projects?" Design Thinking is a non-linear, iterative process designed to help teams understand their users, challenge assumptions, identify problems, and create innovative solutions to prototype and test. It is especially helpful for teams trying to tackle problems that are not clearly defined, and it involves five phases: *Empathize *Define *Ideate *Prototype * Test Design Thinking helps teams consider alternate ways to handle challenges. From a project management point of view, teams should not be limited to thinking about a waterfall, agile, or lean approach, but rather, they should consider which methodologies exist outside of the project space that could lead to uncovering a new way of working. During our workshop, we will cover human centered design, Design Thinking as a methodology, and tools that lead to improved results. üìù Agenda: 1)What is Design Thinking? 2)How does the process work? 3)A deep-dive of the five stages 4)Exploring the difference between methodologies 4)Use cases Audience: PMs Designers BAs Sales üì¢ Speakers: Yuliia Trotsiuk (Project Manager), Andrew Chernov (UI/UX Designer) üëâ Please register here: bit.ly/30yeTQI On the day of the event, you will receive an email with a link üìå Official website: customertimes.com üìå LinkedIn: bit.ly/39zrmXh üìå Facebook: bit.ly/2P75icV

name: Webinar "Meme Generation for Social Media Audience Engagement [Part #1]"
description: In digital marketing, memes have become an attractive tool for engaging an online audience. Memes have an impact on buyers‚Äô and sellers‚Äô online behavior and information spreading processes. Thus, the technology of generating memes is a significant tool for social media engagement. We collected a new memes dataset of ‚àº650K meme instances, applied state of the art Deep Learning technique ‚Äî GPT-2 model towards meme generation, and compared machine-generated memes with human-created. We justified that MTurk workers can be used for the approximate estimating of users‚Äô behavior in a social network, more precisely to measure engagement. üíú Andrew Kurochkin , andrewkurochkin.com "My current professional activity combines enterprise data engineering and data science consultancy. In-depth knowledge of technologies makes my vision pessimistic enough to balance my enthusiasm about the scientific frontier. Overall I‚Äôve been coding and selling my expertise since 2011, 9 years for now. The most enjoyment for me is to maximize systems efficiency and to evoke emergence in systems. I‚Äôm joking a lot, so be ready to have fun. M.S. of Data Science, Andrew." üíú The webinar is free, register here: forms.gle/GFYkmshKJFB2Wbei7

name: Open Tech AMA Session: Past, Present and Future of Java
description: 2020 is rich for all kinds of online events, the web is chock-full of useful content. The piece below will be carefully prepared by top SoftServe experts based on your questions especially for Java-developers. Register here ‚Äî hubs.ly/H0tWFDk0 Join our Open Tech Ask-Me-Anything (AMA) session where we will talk about the Past, Present and the Future of Java. 1. Submit your questions to experts at ‚Äî app.sli.do/event/c4lmxdin (event code 96906) 2. You can also type your question on the registration form ‚Äî hubs.ly/H0tWFDk0 3. Our experts will collect the questions, choose the most popular and answer them during AMA session 4. We will also open the Chat function during the live session to give you and the other viewers the possibility to interact with the speakers. Our panel experts: ‚óè Moderator ‚Äî Serhii Voronin, Senior Java Software Engineer at SoftServe in Dnipro ‚óè Mykhailo Starodynov, Senior Java Software Engineer, Tech Lead at SoftServe in Dnipro ‚óè Vadym Mikhnevych, Application Architect at SoftServe in Chernivtsi Questions categories & Agenda: Part I. Technologies of the past ‚Äî Java 6-8 ‚Äî Security concepts ‚Äî Kotlin Part II. Present technologies ‚Äî Java 11 / 14 ‚Äî Kubernetes ‚Äî Spring Boot ‚Äî Cloud Lambda functions Part III. Technologies of the future ‚Äî Java 15+ ‚Äî WebFlux / Netty ‚Äî Project Loom / Coroutines ‚Äî Spring Apps in GraalVM Learn, share and interact directly with the experts and the community in an online session!
